title: Senior Full Stack Engineer
detail:
100% REMOTE Senior Full Stack Developer / Senior Full Stack Software Engineer Needed for Growing Software Company in the Life Sciences Industry!

This Jobot Job is hosted by: Reed Kellick
Are you a fit? Easy Apply now by clicking the "Apply Now" button and sending us your resume.
Salary: $120,000 - $150,000 per year

A bit about us:

We are a growing software company used by some of the top pharmaceutical and medical device in the nation. We employ hundreds of the most talented people in the industry and we are extremely well-funded. Our team is currently looking to add a talented Senior Fullstack Software Engineer / Senior Fullstack Developer!

Why join us?

As a Senior Fullstack Engineer / Senior Software Engineer in our company, we are able to offer:


A competitive base salary between $120k and $150k! (we MAY go up for the right candidate)
401k!
Annual bonus of up to 15%!
Medical, dental and vision coverage!
Unlimited PTO!
Work from home 100%!


Job Details

As a Senior Software Developer / Senior Full-Stack Engineer on our team, we are looking for:


4+ years of professional experience
Nodejs / Node.js / Node background
TypeScript chops
React / Reactjs / React.js skills
GraphQL experience


Interested in hearing more? Easy Apply now by clicking the "Apply Now" button.

title: Senior Full Stack Engineer
Senior Full Stack Engineer
detail:
Piper Companies is actively seeking a Senior Full Stack Engineer to join a financial service corporation remotely . This is a contract role. The Senior Full Stack Engineer will be responsible for contributing to create a push-back cloud architecture accompanied with infrastructure as a code solution.

Responsibilities of the Senior Full Stack Engineer:

• Responsible for contributing on a team to architect, build, and test the features that combine to form a digital experience.

• Responsible for gaining knowledge about web applications that assist with delivering the best customer experience.

• Leading and collaborating with other developers in the team.

• Work on the Digital Platforms Technology team as a contributor.

Qualifications of the Senior Full Stack Engineer:

• BS/BA Degree or equivalent experience is preferred.

• 8 or more years of experience with focus in financial services.

• Strong experience with JavaScript, Java, Angular.

Compensation for the Senior Full Stack Engineer:

• Salary: $70 a hour

• Full benefits: Medical, Dental, Vision, 401k Match, PTO

Keywords: Engineer, software, software engineer, JavaScript, software development, technology, engineer, computer, computer science, programming, Remote, AWS, Node, DevOps, Route53, coding, infrastructure, senior, full stack, senior engineer, AWS, Java

title: Senior Full Stack Engineer
Senior .NET Full Stack Engineer - REMOTE
detail:
Our premier client in the baking and financial industry is seeking to hire a Full Stack .NET Senior Engineer to join their team as a full-time/ direct-hire employee to work 100% remote!

What Is the Opportunity?
The Full Stack Senior Engineer is responsible for designing, developing and maintaining legacy and "Cloud First" applications written primarily in C# and focused on .NET Core and Azure cloud platform.
The group is continuously working to improve our Agile, Engineering, and DevOps practices and this role will be expected to actively participate in these efforts. At its core, this role requires excellent problem-solving skills and C#/.Net, Java, Python and full stack coding capability.
This role will need to effectively communicate, collaborate, and influence engineering and business team members across many projects and departmental boundaries. The Full Stack Senior Engineer is an advanced senior professional with wide ranging experience who uses various concepts and in-depth evaluation to resolve complex issues in creative and effective ways.
The Full Stack Senior Engineer develops both front-end and back-end solutions. Designs, develops, updates/maintains solutions and provides technical guidance to other Team Members. At this level the main challenge is to identify causes and implement solutions to complex business problems in a multifunctional project, assessing and communicating issues of technology impact on the business.
The colleague in this position would be comfortable with the following activities: Evaluates application software packages and makes recommendations to senior management. Lead & participates with other colleagues in new product reviews, tests, and pilots. Collects & in-depth analyzes business requirements for large projects. Performs in-depth feasibility studies, translates complex requirements into an appropriate design

What will you Do?
Will help lead in the design & development of cross-functional, multi-platform application systems. Writing great quality code with a drive for automated testing and validation based on the You Build You Own (YBYO) model. Perform complex engineering activities for performance tuning, monitoring, deployment and production support. Research, influence and implement vendor dependency to simplify the architecture. Implement, maintain and update CI/CD pipelines on a cloud environment. Collaborate with business partners, architects and other groups to identify complex technical and functional needs of systems based on priority. Collaborate with multiple, enterprise-wide distributed performing teams to deliver new capabilities in business applications. Design and develop APIs for Omni-channel clients. Provide technical guidance to Team members Build APIs and UIs to help make use of large data sets, infrastructure and user experience. Own the full lifecycle for web software development, from ideas to production. Provide programming expertise and business analysis skills within broad business area, usually as a senior member of a project team, in analyzing, designing, modifying, and developing business applications. Create and educate on programming specifications from which programs will be written, and designs, codes, tests, debugs, and documents programs. Create & review programming documentation and recommends changes in development, maintenance, and application standards. Analyze and develop logical database designs, data models and relational data definitions across multiple computing environments (e.g., host based, distributed systems, client server, etc.) Comply with architectural standards and established methodologies and practices.

What do you need to succeed
Must-Have*
Bachelor's Degree or equivalent
Minimum of 6+ years of software development experience And Minimum of 4+ years of experience: Java, .NET, Python And Minimum of 4+ years experience with databases and data modeling / design (SQL and NoSQL) And Minimum of 3+ years coordinating team efforts in a project or operations environment
Minimum of 2 years in full stack development for cloud solutions (Azure or AWS) - Azure preferred

Skills and Knowledge
8+ years of experience in JavaScript development frameworks and tooling: Angular, React, VueJS, & Gulp, Grunt, Yarn, etc.
8+ years of experience managing software development projects through complete release cycles
4+ years of experience leading software engineering teams
2+ years of experience in cloud technologies: Azure(big plus), AWS, OpenStack, etc.
2+ years of experience with container and orchestration: Docker, Kubernetes, etc.
2+ years of experience in build and CICD technologies: GitHub, BitBucket, Azure DevOps, Maven, Jenkins, Nexus or Sonar
2+ years of Scaled agile experience
4+ years of experience in quality assurance technologies: ATDD, Selenium, Cucumber, JUnit, NUnit, SoapUI or Postman
4+ years of experience in Unix Shell scripting
Certified in .Net, Java, Spring or cloud technologies
Exposure of data management methodologies
Experience with serverless architectures and computing


For immediate consideration please submit your resume in Word format, along with daytime contact information. Client is unable to provide H-1B Visa sponsorship at this time. All submittals will be treated confidentially. Selected candidate may be asked to pass a comprehensive background, credit and/or drug screening. Principals only, no third parties please.

Our industry-leading service model combines experienced project managers with seasoned technical and functional consultants to eliminate client uncertainty and deliver superior value and results.

detail:

Kforce has a client in need of a remote Senior Full Stack Engineer.

Summary:
In this role, the Senior Full Stack Engineer will help design and development of cross-functional, multi-platform application systems, and will be writing great quality code with a drive for automated testing and validation based on the You Build You Own (YBYO) model. * 4+ years of experience with databases and data modeling / design (SQL and NoSQL)
* 3+ years of experience coordinating team efforts in a project or operations environment
* Must have .NET/Core .Net experience
* Cloud is required, with Azure strongly preferred
* Must have front end experience with JavaScript frameworks

Kforce is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status.

title: Senior Full Stack Engineer
Senior Principal System Development Engineer
detail:
RESPONSIBILITIES:
Kforce has a client that is seeking a Senior Principal System Development Engineer in McLean, VA.

Overview:
As a leading contributor from a systems perspective, this position will lead and perform lab evaluations and test new and evolutionary technologies across a variety of network and radio frequency (RF) platforms to be used in managed services products. The Senior Principal System Development Engineer will collaborate with DE (Development Engineering) team members, the Innovation Team, and Product Management to deliver new or improved technology platforms that are ready for real world deployment by Network Engineering, Provisioning, and final handover to Network Operations. You will provide expert-level solutions that account for appropriate redundancy, availability, scalability, security, and manageability requirements needed for the successful launch of new products and services or enhancements to existing product and services.

The Senior Principal System Development Engineer will drive best practice development by providing consistent test methodology and modeling for asset management, provisioning standards, fault management analysis, utilization and performance monitoring, and security requirements. We are looking for a strategic expert that is familiar with the integration of existing and emerging technology trends and can provide advanced technical leadership for continued growth. In collaboration with other senior SME's, this position will mentor junior team members and assist in the creation of a training environment for the Deployment and Operations teams.

REQUIREMENTS:
* A Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, or similar discipline with at least seven years of network and/or systems experience (or an equivalent amount of education and work experience)
* Must have Expert-level knowledge of Satellite Broadband systems like iDirect, Gilat, Comtech, Newtec Dialog or HNS Jupiter
* Must have Expert-level knowledge of system hub components and VSAT Terminals and VSAT Antennas
* Must have experience with IP routing protocols, including but not limited to: BGP, OSPF, EIGRP, RIP-1/2 and ISIS
* Must have knowledge of switching technologies including but not limited to; IGMP, 802.XX, Gigabit Ethernet, 10G Ethernet, Vlan/Trunking (802.1q and ISL), Etherchannel, Spanning Tree (STP), HSRP, VRRP
* Knowledge of IP traffic and network loading test tools such as Spirent
* Must have extensive knowledge and experience in RF communications engineering technologies, including: Small to large antenna systems technology, IF/RF DIFL communications systems and subsystems, and all standard frequency bands; L-, C-, Ku-, and Ka-Bands (Q & V Bands a plus)
* RF signal processing technologies and theory, and modulation techniques ranging from QPSK to 16 QAM and 256 APSK
* Satellite modem technologies, including DVB-S2x, ACM, VCM, CCM, and carrier cancellation
* Ability to design and configure lab test setups utilizing equipment such as spectrum analyzers, DSP's, network analyzers, equalizers, noise generators, power meters, and signal generators
* Expert-level knowledge with capability of designing and testing platform-based systems utilizing technologies from vendors including iDirect, Comtech, Newtec, Gilat and others

Kforce is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status.

detail:
Zachary Piper Solutions is seeking a Senior Full Stack Developer for a PERMANENT, REMOTE position with a few on-site meetings a year in Chantilly, VA, developing software products used by the federal government. This position will primarily be utilizing MEAN Stack technologies.

Responsibilities of the Senior Full Stack Developer:

Design and development of web applications
Utilize the latest features of Angular and Node
Solve complex technical challenges
Learn and test new technologies on a regular basis


Requirements for the Senior Full Stack Developer:

BS in Computer Science or a related field
5+ years of experience in full stack software engineering
Strength in recent versions of Angular (2+), NodeJS
Experience with MongoDB or other NoSQL databases
Experience leading, mentoring other developers, leading code reviews
Must be eligible for a DOD Secret clearance (can hold TS)


Compensation for the Senior Full Stack Developer:

$130,000 - $160,000 annual salary, based on experience
Full benefits - medical/dental/vision, 401k, PTO, paid holidays


Keywords: MEAN, MERN, Full Stack, MongoDB, Mongo, ExpressJS, Angular, Angular 2+, Angular4, Angular6, Angular7, Angular8, Angular9, React, Node.js, NodeJS, Node, Java, SpringBoot, JavaScript

- Express

- RESTful API design and implementation

- Excellent communication and leadership skills

- Strong analytical skills

- Experience with Agile methodology

description:
CornerStone Professional Placement is currently seeking of a Senior API Software Engineers with 7+ years of experience working with Python. This is a Full time REMOTE role with amazing benefits including unlimited PTO! As an API Software Engineer, you will be responsible for designing, building and maintaining APIs and systems. Would you like to have start to finish ownership from ideation, design, launch and beyond? You will be debug and maintain production systems deployed in a cloud environment. If you want to step-up your career with innovative technology in a space that is traditionally antiquated and given the opportunity to be the first to market with smart, easy to use, fully integrated software for an industry that desperately needs it. This is an incredible opportunity with a company that makes your personal growth top priority. Don’t miss out on it! They are doubling in size again and business is booming!

Job title: Senior API Software Engineer
Location: US-Remote
Compensation: Generous Base + Equity (choose equity or base forward compensation)
PTO: Unlimited!
Duration: Direct hire with benefits!
OPEN FOR SPONSORSHIP

Requirements:

- 7+ years of experience with API web development
- Hands-on Python experience
- Experience building and maintaining APIs and web services
- Bachelor’s degree in an Engineering field or relevant experience.
- Smart, Bright and Passionate team player!

Culture:
- Focuses on problems and solutions (not finding who to blame)
- Values employees as partners- You are their #1 priority!
- True seat at the table!
- Truly diverse with a mission to make a difference in their space which will be amazingly simple and unbelievably impactful nationwide.
- Work with the brightest, most passionate and diverse pool of professionals to create and solve problems together
- Be a part of the transformation!

title: Senior Software Engineer/Senior Full Stack Engineer - API
Senior Full Stack Engineer
detail:
Zachary Piper Solutions is seeking a Senior Full Stack Engineer in a hybrid position based out of Arlington, Virginia. The Sr. Full Stack Engineer will support the development of mission-critical functions for the Drug Enforcement Administration (DEA).

Location: Hyrbrid - based out of Arlington, Virginia (on-site 2-3 days a week)

Salary: $120,000.00 - $ 150,000.00 *Depending on experience*

Full Benefits: PTO, Paid Holidays, Cigna Medical, Dental, Vision, 401k, etc.

Clearance: Secret Clearance

Responsibilities of the Senior Full Stack Engineer Include:

Design, develop and enhance code for the DEA's application framework ensuring development standards are met
Utilization of Agile development methodologies.
Conducts code reviews for team members
Ensure application development standards are met along with supporting development teams
Collaborate with UI and UX designers to develop the best experience for our end users.
Write tests to ensure code is accurate and troubleshoot/debug code as needed.

Qualifications for the Senior Full Stack Engineer Include:

7 - 10+ years experience in web development and Visual Studio 2008 experience or higher
Strong working knowledge of the C# programming language.
5+ years of ASP.NET MVC based web development.
Experience with key technologies such as:
ORM frameworks (Entity Framework preferred)
Microsoft SQL Server.
Client side JavaScript and jQuery on interactive web pages.
HTML and CSS.
3+ years of experience with Agile development methodologies.
Experience with automated testing (unit tests and/or coded UI tests)

title: Senior Full Stack Engineer
Senior Full Stack Engineer
detail:
Atrilogy's direct client is seeking a Senior Full Stack Engineer to join their team which is a 100% Remote.

Job Details:
Title: Senior Full Stack Engineer (W2 Only)
Location: 100% Remote

Department: T&I - DIGITAL TECHNOLOGIES

As a Senior Full Stack Engineer you will have an outsized impact and build the foundation for our financial service products that define the future of our company. You will work in an agile environment with service-oriented tech stack. The following four virtues are reflected in our team and our product:
Initiative: You don't wait around for something to happen - you make it happen.
Zeal: You are ambitious, relentless, and lively - making your presence felt;
Openness: You are candid, vulnerable, and receptive in discussing ideas, perspectives, and feedback.
Reliability: You're dependable and can be trusted. You deliver high-quality work and outcomes.

Skills:
6+ years of software engineering experience on a SaaS app
Deep understanding of system design, data modeling and software architecture Expertise in designing and implementing.
GraphQL and REST based API for omni-channel consumption(4 years) using Node.js
Strong experience and proficiency in TypeScript
Experience integrating 3rd party APIs
Comfortable building full-stack features from scratch
Self-motivated with a high level of autonomy Can work on a small team, in a fast paced environment
Collaborate & mentor current and future engineering members
At least 2 years of experience with TDD and BDD preferred
At least 2 years of experience with CICD preferred Experience in Azure or similar cloud platform is a huge plus


Tech Stack:
Server: NestJS, TypeScript, GraphQL, Express
Client: Mobile (ios & android), Vue SPA, TypeScript,
Infrastructure: Kubernetes, Azure, Automated pipeline deployments Daily Responsibilities:

100% Hands On
100% Team Collaboration

Required Skills:
Asynchronous JavaScript

Additional Skills:
DevOps, Docker, Engineer, JavaScript, Kafka, Nexus, NoSQL, NUnit, Operations, Quality Assurance, SASS, Scripting, Selenium, Shell Scripting, Software Development, Software Engineering, Sonar, Spring, SQL, Tooling, UI, Unix, Unix Shell, UX, API, Architecture, Automated Testing, B2B Software

For immediate consideration please submit your resume in Word format, along with daytime contact information. Client is unable to provide H-1B Visa sponsorship at this time . All submittals will be treated confidentially. Selected candidate may be asked to complete a comprehensive background, credit and/or drug screening. Principals only, no third parties please.

Atrilogy Solutions Group, Inc. (est. 2000), in partnership with Peak17 Consulting (est. 2008), provides organizations of all sizes with high-quality, cost effective information technology (IT) staffing services.

Atrilogy has been recognized by Inc. magazine as one of the nation's fastest-growing, privately held companies. Headquartered in Irvine, California, Atrilogy also has offices in Denver, Phoenix, & Atlanta with satellite offices in Boston, Jersey City, Las Vegas, and Delhi, India.

Clients turn to Atrilogy for expertise in:
IT staffing and placement such as Project Managers, Agile/Scrum Masters, Business Analysts, DBAs, Software Engineers, Mobile Developers (iOS, Android), DevOps, Automation, QA, Systems & Network Engineers, Cyber Security / Information Security Specialists, ERP, CRM, Business Intelligence, Data Warehousing, Big Data and Creative (UI/UX, Web Design)

Clients turn to Peak17 for expertise in:
Operational staffing and placement of Accounting/Finance, Human Resources, and Marketing professionals, as well as Information Technology resources.

Atrilogy Solutions Group and Peak17 Consulting are Equal Opportunity Employers. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, protected veteran status, or any other basis protected by applicable law, and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.

In compliance with federal law, all persons hired will be required to verify identity and eligibility to work in the United States and to complete the required employment eligibility verification document form upon hire.

title: Senior Full Stack Engineer
Senior Java Full Stack Engineer
detail:
RESPONSIBILITIES:
Kforce has a client in Columbus, OH that is seeking a Senior Java Full Stack Engineer.

Summary:
As an experienced member of our Software Engineering Group, we look first and foremost for people who are passionate around solving business problems through innovation and engineering practices. The Senior Java Full Stack Engineer will be required to apply their depth of knowledge and expertise to all aspects of the software development lifecycle, as well as partner continuously with many stakeholders on a daily basis to stay focused on common goals. We embrace a culture of experimentation and constantly strive for improvement and learning. The Senior Java Full Stack Engineer will work in a collaborative, trusting, thought-provoking environment-one that encourages diversity of thought and creative solutions that are in the best interests of our customers globally. Strong Java Spring Boot Developers looking to be trained on front end technologies also encouraged to apply.

REQUIREMENTS:
* 5+ years of Java development experience
* Familiarity with Cloud Platforms including AWS, CloudFoundry or Kubernetes
* Proficiency with development tools (Jenkins, Jira, BitBucket, IntelliJ, Git, code quality & security scanning tools)
* UI Development skills in either React or Angular

Kforce is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status.

description:
RESPONSIBILITIES:
Kforce has a client in Columbus, OH that is seeking a Senior Java Full Stack Engineer.

Summary:
As an experienced member of our Software Engineering Group, we look first and foremost for people who are passionate around solving business problems through innovation and engineering practices. The Senior Java Full Stack Engineer will be required to apply their depth of knowledge and expertise to all aspects of the software development lifecycle, as well as partner continuously with many stakeholders on a daily basis to stay focused on common goals. We embrace a culture of experimentation and constantly strive for improvement and learning. The Senior Java Full Stack Engineer will work in a collaborative, trusting, thought-provoking environment-one that encourages diversity of thought and creative solutions that are in the best interests of our customers globally. Strong Java Spring Boot Developers looking to be trained on front end technologies also encouraged to apply.

REQUIREMENTS:
* 5+ years of Java development experience
* Familiarity with Cloud Platforms including AWS, CloudFoundry or Kubernetes
* Proficiency with development tools (Jenkins, Jira, BitBucket, IntelliJ, Git, code quality & security scanning tools)
* UI Development skills in either React or Angular

Kforce is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status.

description:
Background
About Alliance DAO
Alliance is the leading Web3 accelerator and founder community. Since early 2020, we've helped the top 1% of Web3 founders start and grow their companies. We do so through a 9-week program led by leading experts. Our community includes fellow founders, lawyers, auditors, market makers and more. Together, we will grow Web3 to one billion users by 2025.

Origin Story
In March of 2020, top-tier trading and venture firms CMT Digital, Cumberland DRW, Jump Capital and Volt Capital joined to form the DeFi Alliance, an accelerator program to help early stage DeFi startups source liquidity. We accelerated more than 90 startups with the support from more than 200 entities in our support network. In January of 2020, DeFi Alliance and hundreds of other top builders joined forces to form Alliance DAO, the world's first digital startup nation, to accelerate the best Web3 startups.

Products
Web3 Accelerator Program. A 9-week program featuring talks from leading experts, hands-on mentorship, demo days and more to help build your project and community.
Alliance DAO Network (ADN). A community of stakeholders in the Web3 startup ecosystem. Our members include fellow founders, lawyers, auditors, market makers and many more. Our community is supported by various online products such as a founder’s forum, web app, jobs board and governance tools.

What We Offer
- Work with world-class Web3 founders, investors, and other industry leaders and be exposed to the most exciting projects working at the cutting edge of Web3
- Join a growing team with a strong reputation, investment portfolio, and Accelerator business led by experienced entrepreneurs who have founded some of the leading companies in the crypto space.

- Competitive salary
- Competitive equity/token compensation
- Unlimited vacation policy
- Medical, dental, and vision
- A remote work environment with an international and diverse team

POSITION SPEC

Title: Senior Software Engineer
Location: Remote
Compensation: Competitive salary plus equity
Experience: Senior

As a founding team Senior Engineer, you will drive the development of products that will help thousands of Web 3 entrepreneurs start & grow their startups to millions of users.

Today, these include (1) our exclusive member platform, (2) tooling and automation for our accelerator, (3) external products to help companies hire and receive grants.

We're just getting started, however, and we expect you to have a strong voice into what Alliance will build next in partnership with our Head of Product.

In addition to the above, you will also be responsible for contributing to our internal engineering practices and standards, as well as hiring and mentoring other engineers.

Core Duties & Responsibilities

Be responsible for developing and delivering high-impact, high-quality, well-tested, and scalable software
Work on community centric Web2 and Web3 products
Build sleek front end interfaces with a user-first mindset
Build performant back end services
Work as part of a team and mentor junior engineers
Help shape our technical roadmap and share ideas for the product roadmap as we scale our services and build new products

Requirements

6+ years of software engineering experience
2+ years of experience at FAANG or venture backed startup / scale-up with equivalent high reputation engineering team
Recent full stack experience and comfort switching between front end / back end work
Experience delivering consumer-facing products from definition to delivery
Experience with software engineering best practices such as unit testing, code reviews, design, and documentation
A strong understanding of building and debugging scalable web applications built with reusability in mind
A solid grasp of Javascript fundamentals
Strong communication skills both written and verbal
The ability to work effectively as part of a distributed remote team
Able to balance speed and quality when building

Highly Desired Attributes

Solidity experience
Web3 development experience
Prior early stage start up experience
Knowledge or experience in Web 3 including gaming, NFTs, or tokenized communities
Engineering management experience or desire to lead or manage over time

Technologies We Use

Typescript
React
Next.js
Blitz.js
Node.js
Prisma
PostgreSQL

Alliance At A Glance
Alliance focuses on venture capital, incubators, accelerators, bitcoin, ethereum, cryptocurrency, and blockchains. We are a distributed team of 10-15.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $180,000.00 - $200,000.00 per year

Benefits:

Dental insurance
Health insurance
Paid time off
Vision insurance

Schedule:

8 hour shift

Experience:

software engineering: 6 years (Preferred)
FAANG or venture backed startup: 2 years (Preferred)

Work Location: Remote

Senior Principal Architect
detail:
**This position requires someone to work a hybrid schedule, qualified candidates must be comfortable coming onsite in Reston, VA.**

Our client, a leading healthcare provider is looking for a Senior Principal Architect to help further the client's enterprise application integration.

We will accept corp to corp or w2 contractors. For our w2 consultants, we offer a great benefits package that includes Medical, Dental, and Vision benefits, 401k with company matching, and life insurance.
Requirements of the Senior Principal Architect:

A Bachelor's degree and at least 15 years of experience in software development
Proven strong technical architecture design background
Deep knowledge of the Portal technology domain, data management and database technologies
Solid understanding on enterprise application integration and Workflow technology
Experience implementing complex business processes and applications
Demonstrated experience supporting B2B environments
Prior experience in monitoring, analyzing, and recommending solutions in high-traffic, large-scale distributed systems and integration architecture

Job ID: 368610

About Eliassen Group:

Eliassen Group provides strategic consulting and talent solutions to drive our clients' innovation and business results. Our purpose is to positively impact the lives of our employees, clients, consultants, and the communities in which we operate. Leveraging over 30 years of success, our expertise in talent solutions, life sciences consulting, Agile consulting, cloud services, risk management, business optimization, and managed services enables us to partner with our clients to execute their business strategy and scale effectively. Headquartered in Reading, MA, and with offices from coast to coast, Eliassen Group offers local community presence and deep networks, as well as national reach.

Eliassen Group is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status.

Don't miss out on our referral program! If we hire a candidate that you refer us to then you can be eligible for a $1,000 referral check!

A Kforce client is seeking to hire a Senior Full Stack Engineer in Los Angeles, California (CA).

As a Senior Full Stack Engineer, you will have an outsized impact and build the foundation for our products that define the future of our company. You will work in an agile environment with service-oriented tech stack.

* 4+ years of expertise in designing and implementing Graph QL and REST based API for omni-channel consumption using Node.js

title: Senior Full Stack Engineer
Senior Full Stack Engineer
detail:
Job Description A company based in the Greater Boston Area is in need of a passionate Senior Full Stack .NET Engineer that also has a strong understanding of front-end technologies. This company develops a cloud-based platform, specializing in financial relief to college students across the country. They main goal is to provide post graduate workers with financial benefits that alleviate student loan debt through employer benefits. In addition, they are dedicated to not only saving current post grads from crippling debt but also determined to provide them a financial foundation for their children's educational future. As a Senior Full-Stack Engineer, you will be working with architects, DevOps, QA, business users and a variety of other developers in a collaborative environment. They need a candidate with an ambition to problem solve and is dedicated to giving back to the development community. Required Skills & Experience - 4+ years developing with C#/.NET - Strong JavaScript experience (React preferred) - Experience with SQL - DevOps Experience Desired Skills & Experience - Bachelor of Science in Computer Science or related field - Ecommerce experience is a big plus - Collaborative mindset - Experience working in a cloud hosted environment What You Will Be Doing
Daily Responsibilities

90% coding
10% team collaboration

title: Senior Full Stack Engineer
Senior Full Stack Engineer
detail:
RESPONSIBILITIES:
Kforce has a client in need of a remote Full Stack Engineer.

Responsibilities:
* In this role, the Senior Full Stack Engineer will help design and development of cross-functional, multi-platform application systems
* Writing great quality code with a drive for automated testing and validation based on the You Build You Own (YBYO) model
* Perform complex engineering activities for performance tuning, monitoring, deployment and production support
* Research, influence and implement vendor dependency to simplify the architecture
* The Senior Full Stack Engineer will implement, maintain and update CI/CD pipelines on a cloud environment

REQUIREMENTS:
* Must have .NET/Core .Net experience
* Cloud experience is required, with Azure strongly preferred
* Must have front end experience with JavaScript frameworks
* Candidates qualifying for this position will have similar experience along with the skills and abilities to perform the duties mentioned
* Any relevant education and/or training will be considered a plus

Kforce is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status.

Client Details

The client is a Fortune 500 Company in the beauty and retail space. They have a strong commitment to company culture, work life balance, and creating a diverse workforce.

Description



You will be a leader on a team of skilled Front End Developers working on creating excellent front end experiences across their branded e-commerce websites


Expand the use of React on their websites

Code review and mentor junior Engineers

title: Senior Full Stack Engineer
Senior Full Stack Engineer
detail:
Offers relocation, sign-on bonus, and equity.

This Jobot Job is hosted by: Tyler May
Are you a fit? Easy Apply now by clicking the "Apply Now" button and sending us your resume.
Salary: $150,000 - $170,000 per year

A bit about us:

We are a fast-growing and profitable SaaS company that is revolutionizing the way global users create time for themselves! Our world is becoming more and more plugged in and are consumers are changing. We are the 1st in the Industry to develop this software solution aimed at enabling humans to be 5X more efficient. We are actively looking for a Senior Full Stack Engineer who can help take our product to the next level.

As a Senior Full Stack Engineer, you are capable of handling all aspects of the technology, from the expansion of new clients to implementing new features. You enjoy facing new challenges and the sense of accomplishment from tackling them. Never a dull day, the healthy mix of both production and R&D projects ensures that the work is both challenging and fast paced.

Why join us?

Our mission to is building the digital OS for the food supply chain. Our eCommerce platform enables food distributors to find new customers, deepen relationships, grow revenue, and run more efficiently. Started by the team that took Uber Eats from a small experiment to a billion dollar business, we're more excited than ever about building the technology that unlocks the food industry's full potential. We believe in the power of a diverse team. We operate with high autonomy, and in return expect high accountability to one another.

We also include:


Competitive base salary and equity
Unlimited PTO
Excellent medical, dental, and vision package
401(k)
Health Savings Account
Opportunity for growth


Job Details

Is your background a fit? Apply if you meet this criteria:

Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science.
5+ years of experience.
Experience with Python
React.js experience preferred
Preferred, but not required would be to have worked in a fast-growth company that is scaling fast.

title: Senior Full Stack Engineer
detail:
Senior Full Stack Engineer

Fully Remote

Summary:

5+ years of experience building reliable and performant micro-services.
Extensive experience building and scaling Enterprise SaaS products
Comfort and proven experience developing on the front-end, back-end, and even the database.
Technical depth and mastery in at least one software engineering topic (networking, security, serverless, event streams, etc.)
Eagerness to share your own ideas, and openness to those of others.
Experience working in F, Node.js but identify as a polyglot.
Experience using JavaScript frameworks in production (we use React.js).
Experience with AWS.
Experience with ML, AI.

Job Description

Who We Are

At Firstup, we take pride in powering the global workforce of the future by transforming workforce communications and the digital employee experience. We now serve 40 of the Fortune 100 companies, reaching and connecting more than 15 million employees daily.

Our employees are experts in the digital employee experience, workforce communications and technology. Joining Firstup means joining a movement to connect every worker. Now we need your help. Are you ready to make a difference in the world?

Our Values

Every Employee is an Owner with responsibility and credit for our progress.

Leadership is in our build and we see change as a catalyst for improvement.

We win as a team, committed to help our coworkers and customers thrive.

Position Summary

We're looking for talented Senior Full Stack Engineers to join our team! You will have opportunities to work closely with customers to solve real technology challenges. We are rapidly expanding and you will be responsible for delivering new solutions and services while constantly improving our approach to architecture, scale, availability and fault-tolerance. Engineering is a craft, and at Firstup we believe the internals of our technology should be as elegant as user experience. If there is a specific challenge you are looking for, we most likely have it for you.

Teams are empowered and supported to do their best work every day. We work in cross-functional autonomous product teams, so you'll interact with Product Managers, Designers, QA, and other engineers on a daily basis. You will partner with others across the company in shared codebases, and contribute directly to other services when needed. We iterate quickly to see what works and what doesn’t and follow the data to drive our strategy. We encourage you to take chances and fail because that is how we learn and grow. We are a distributed team and have been since day 1. We build solutions for distributed workforces so we model our workforce the same way. In this role you really can work where you want within the United States.

Responsibilities

Utilize your real-world knowledge and experience to help us build scalable SaaS applications
Write high-quality code (i.e., reliable, readable, efficient, testable, scalable, maintainable), provide quality code reviews, create comprehensive tests and quality documentation.
Apply broad, in-depth knowledge to develop and maintain large-scale multi-tenant services in the cloud.
Collaborate across teams on industry standards and best practices to help others solve complex problems.
Design future ready solutions and address architectural gaps.
Recognize opportunities and advocate for better performance and efficiency of software, systems, processes across teams.
Identify, analyze, and resolve system availability, reliability, and performance issues.
Encourage and promote ideas/opinions of others from diverse backgrounds and experiences.

You Have

5+ years of experience building reliable and performant micro-services.
Comfort and proven experience developing on the front-end, back-end, and even the database.
Technical depth and mastery in at least one software engineering topic (networking, security, serverless, event streams, etc.)
Excitement and drive to build beautiful, intuitive products.
Innate curiosity, and a desire to learn and teach. Empathy for your customers and colleagues.
Eagerness to share your own ideas, and openness to those of others.
Experience working in Ruby, Node.js but identify as a polyglot.
Experience using JavaScript frameworks in production (we use React.js).

You Might Have

Experience with Kubernetes, Docker, Helm.
Experience with AWS.
Experience with ML, AI.
Experience working for a start-up and/or SaaS organization.
Open-source contributions and history of side-projects.

Apply Here today

title: Senior Full Stack Engineer
Senior Principal Software Engineer
detail:
Senior Principal Software Engineer - 204782 - Tampa

Are you ready to explore a world of possibilities?

Join our DTCC family, and you'll grow your expertise and become the best version of you. As you embark on a new journey, you'll be supported and surrounded by other professionals as you learn new skills, advance your career, and see the impact of your efforts every day.

Pay and Benefits:

Competitive compensation, including base pay and annual incentive
Comprehensive health and life insurance and well-being benefits, based on location
Retirement benefits
Paid Time Off and other leave of absence
Flexible/Hybrid Work Arrangements

Why You'll Love This Job

The Development family is responsible for creating, designing, deploying, and supporting applications, programs, and software solutions. May include research, new development, prototyping, modification, reuse, re-engineering, maintenance, or any other activities related to software products used internally or externally on product platforms supported by the firm. The software development process requires in-depth subject matter expertise in existing and emerging development methodologies, tools, and programming languages. Software Developers work closely with business partners and / or external clients in defining requirements and implementing solutions.

The Software Engineering role specializes in planning, documenting technical requirements, designing, developing, and testing all software systems and applications for the firm. Works closely with architects, product managers, project management, and end-users in the development and enhancement of existing software systems and applications, proposing and recommending solutions that solve complex business problems.

Your Primary Responsibilities:

Create and improve critical systems through the application of a broad business understanding, application development experience and technical knowledge
Collaborate with business development, architecture, and infrastructure colleagues to analyze overall business problems and objectives
Design strategies and solutions applying knowledge of current industry trends
Provide technical leadership and guidance to teams through all phases of projects and advise IT senior leaders regarding strategic direction
Translate complex business processes, technical designs, and concerns into easy to understand language
Present architectural design proposals to ensure technology platforms and solutions meet customer needs
Drive IT specific best practices & standards to ensure compliance with regulatory requirements
Mitigates risk by following established procedures, spotting key errors and demonstrating strong ethical behavior.

*Note: Responsibilities of this role are not limited to the details above*

Talents Needed For Success

Minimum of 10 years of Software Development experience in Distributed and Mainframe technologies.
Bachelor's degree preferred or equivalent experience
Inspires different approaches or ways of working.
Inspires teams to constructively challenge established views.
Presents information clearly in writing and orally in larger group settings.
Convinces others on key topics by presenting persuasive arguments and alternative approaches.
Sets an example for others by personally embracing change; Builds ownership for change by empowering others to lead change initiatives.

DTCC is the heart of the post-trade market infrastructure for the global financial services industry. From 21 locations all over the world, DTCC, through its subsidiaries, automates, centralizes and standardizes the processing of financial transactions, mitigating risk, increasing transparency and driving efficiency for thousands of broker/dealers, custodian banks and asset managers. In 2020, DTCC's subsidiaries processed securities transactions valued at more than U.S. $2.3 quadrillion.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, sex, gender, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.



About Us

About DTCC

DTCC safeguards the financial markets and helps them run efficiently, in times of prosperity and crisis. We are uniquely positioned at the center of global trading activity, processing over 100 million financial transactions every day, pioneering industry-wide, post-trade solutions and maintaining multiple data and operating centers worldwide. From where we stand, we can anticipate the industry's needs and we're working to continually improve the world's most resilient, secure and efficient market infrastructure. Our employees are driven to deliver innovative technologies that improve efficiency, lower cost and bring stability and certainty to the post-trade lifecycle.

DTCC proudly supports Flexible Work Arrangements favoring openness and gives people freedom to do their jobs well, by encouraging diverse opinions and emphasizing teamwork. When you join our team, you'll have an opportunity to make meaningful contributions at a company that is recognized as a thought leader in both the financial services and technology industries. A DTCC career is more than a good way to earn a living. It's the chance to make a difference at a company that's truly one of a kind.



About the Team

The IT SIFMU Delivery Department supports core Clearing and Settlement application delivery for DTC, NSCC and FICC. The department also develops and supports Asset Services, Wealth Management & Insurance Services and Master Reference Data applications.

title: Senior Principal Software Engineer
Senior Full Stack Engineer - Healthcare
detail:
A company based out in San Francisco is looking for a Senior Full Stack Engineer! This would be a full-time, remote role. The environment is primarily Python, Django, Javascript, and React.

The company has a virtual pharmacist software that takes a patients' medical/pharmacy claims, lab results, EMR data, and more into account to generate a report on their patients' health. With that report, the company also uses an algorithm to create medication recommendations. The Senior Full Stack Engineer will be designing and developing new features for a platform that impacts the cost and efficacy of people. They will also be writing automated tests for their web components and APIs, as well as maintain and improve existing features.
Required Skills & Experience
5+ years experience software engineer experience
Experience developing Python APIs
Experience with Javascript/Typescript, ReactJS and NodeJS
Experience with AWS
Experience with NoSQL databases
Experience with UI/UX design
What You Will Be Doing
Tech Breakdown

60% FE / 40% BE
The Offer
You will receive the following benefits:

Medical Insurance
Dental Benefits
Vision Benefits
Paid Time Off (PTO)
401(k)

Applicants must be currently authorized to work in the US on a full-time basis now and in the future.

They place Doctors, nurses, machine technicians, and other healthcare positions. They realized the technology the industry uses to operate are outdated and not specific to healthcare, so they decided to build their own Application Tracking Systems and Vendor Management System.

As a Senior Full Stack back end engineer you will collaborate with a group of gifted engineers who have launched two SaaS applications in the healthcare staffing sector. Microsoft technologies were used to create a brand-new codebase for these goods that was started in 2018 and created from the ground up for the cloud. Working with specialists from the industry, you will gather requirements, design and create new features, support already-existing features, and interact with other products through APIs in this position. The area of expertise will be broad with a focus on delivering powerful tech that is user-friendly and enjoyable. description:
Job Description One of the top Healthcare staffing companies in the industry are looking for Senior Full-Stack backend Engineer that works with .net. They place Doctors, nurses, machine technicians, and other healthcare positions. They realized the technology the industry uses to operate are outdated and not specific to healthcare, so they decided to build their own Application Tracking Systems and Vendor Management System.

As a Senior Full Stack back end engineer you will collaborate with a group of gifted engineers who have launched two SaaS applications in the healthcare staffing sector. Microsoft technologies were used to create a brand-new codebase for these goods that was started in 2018 and created from the ground up for the cloud. Working with specialists from the industry, you will gather requirements, design and create new features, support already-existing features, and interact with other products through APIs in this position. The area of expertise will be broad with a focus on delivering powerful tech that is user-friendly and enjoyable. Required Skills & Experience • .NET, C#, .NET Core • Azure • SQL • Restful APIs • JavaScript/JQUery • MSSQL Database
Desired Skills & Experience

Experience with React
Bachelor's Degree in computer science

Tech Breakdown

80% New development
10% Architecture
10% Maintenance
What You Will Be Doing
Daily Responsibilities

Designing, developing, consuming APIs.
Maintain quality and ensure responsiveness of applications
Maintain code integrity and organization
Ensure cross-platform optimization for mobile phones.
Partner closely with Product Manager and Account Manager to craft great product experiences.
Design, deliver, and evolve solutions through hands-on execution of engineering, quality assurance, and delivery.
The Offer
Medical Insurance
Dental Benefits
Vision Benefits
Paid Time Off (PTO)
401(k)


Applicants must be currently authorized to work in the US on a full-time basis now and in the future.

description:
Job Description:
CSC Generation Holdings family of brands is saving Retail. We acquire store and catalog-based retailers, and transform them into high performing, “digital first” brands. In just four years, we’ve acquired and turned around brands including: Sur La Table, Z Gallerie, Direct Buy and One Kings Lane, saving thousands of jobs and reaching over a billion dollars in revenue.

As a Senior Full Stack Engineer (React), you will work on a team to build best-in-class microservices, business-facing user dashboards, and customer-facing experiences. Our senior full-stack engineers own the technical facets of our various services within our application cloud. We are building a constellation of API-and-SDK first, composable services, working to make our systems programmable and discoverable for other teams within the business. You should love quality abstractions, good systems design, and patterns as much as we do.

Your day to day responsibilities will include:

Work with product teams to architect and implement a service in our retail cloud
Design and implement in Typescript (we can teach you) / JS, React, on AWS
Building quality, functional code that you and your team can be proud of
Publish APIs, SDKs, and CLIs for your systems that other developers can use
Write responsive and functional components in React for the front-end
Learn and keep up with current best practices for elegant code and projects

Our ideal candidate is someone that:

Can work on both frontend and backend components of an application (if you're stronger on the frontend or backend, we'd still like to hear from you)
Can be the technical owner of an internally facing consumer microservice product
Has around 7+ years of experience, in areas of our tech stack: Typescript, Javascript, Node, React, AWS (ie: Lambda, CloudFront, CodePipeline, this one is trainable)
Strong sense of ownership for the entire software lifecycle, not only to the next handoff
Believe in finding the best solution, not just one that works

What's in it for you:

Career growth opportunities with a rapidly growing company!
Work with and learn from top technical talent
See the impact and scope of your work clearly and directly
Competitive comp package
Don't worry, we won’t ask you to go back into the office. Work remotely indefinitely! :)
Unlimited PTO (For US employees)

CSC Generation provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

detail:
A company based out in San Francisco is looking for a Senior FullStack Engineer! This would be a full-time, remote role. The environment is primarily React, Redux and Ruby on Rails.

The data analytics company, which focuses on the entertainment industry, is planning on scaling out version 2 of their web application. They created Ad EnGage to measure the effectiveness of TV video advertisement in real time. The Senior Full Stack Engineer would be helping scale their application and backend processes related to their automated reporting tools. They would be collaborating with various teams such as the product, design, and backend teams.

5+ years experience software engineer experience

title: Senior Full Stack Engineer - Rails and React
Senior Full Stack Engineer - Remote
detail:
We are seeking a Senior Full-Stack Engineer with 8+ years' experience as a product-focused software developer (4+ years with React; 2+ with Typescript) to join our growing tech team.

Please note that at this time we are unable to support C2C or 1099.

In our organization, full-stack engineers can be working on any of our user-facing products. On a day-to-day basis, you could be doing anything from building out user interfaces in React to building out authentication flows and data layer integrations. In this role, you will be the most senior full-stack member of our US-based engineering team and you'll be responsible for contributing to decisions around tech stack, third-party library choices, software architecture, testing strategies and more! You'll also play an integral role in technically mentoring and growing more junior members on our team.

A little about our product tech stack:
Our primary programming language is Typescript
We are using Next.JS to build out our new web-based product experiences
We are looking to build out native mobile experiences as well - we are currently looking to leverage our existing responsive web experiences using Capacitor.JS or similar but have also had experience with React Native
We are using Contentful as a CMS to drive our marketing websites
We are using Auth0 as an identity solution for authenticating nurses
We have a team building out a scalable data layer. That team is building out APIs / services in Python - the full-stack engineers would be building products that integrate with this layer
In general, we deploy our software in AWS in EKS / Kubernetes

Reporting to our Director of Engineering, you'll be a hands-on coder who leverages your previous experience to ensure best practices and offer advice and reviews on architecture, design, and implementation.


What you'll be working on:
Architecting solutions, building features, creating tools, maintaining code, and writing tests for new and existing products
Providing technical leadership, code reviews, and mentoring to fellow engineers
Contributing to the evolution of our tech stack selections to meet business needs
Work with the product team to understand requirements, formulate use cases, and then translate that into an effective technical solution.

You'll bring to the table:
8+ years experience as a product-focused software developer
4+ years experience with React
2+ years experience with Typescript
In-depth knowledge of HTTP and REST APIs and how to best interact with these from React
In-depth knowledge of unit/integration testing in the React ecosystem using Jest or similar
Experience with Next.JS or a similar React-based SSR/SSG framework
Experience effectively organizing and mentoring more junior staff technically
Experience with React Native or Capacitor a bonus

Pay Range: $130k - $175k/yr, based on location, qualifications, and experience

Benefits package includes: Health, Dental, Vision, HSA/FSA, Company-paid Life & Disability insurance, 401K w/ employer match, Paid Time off, Paid Parental Leave, and Tuition Reimbursement

Applicants for employment in the US must have valid work authorization that does not now and/or will not in the future require sponsorship of a visa for employment authorization in the US.

We are an equal opportunity employer and make hiring decisions based on merit. Recruitment, hiring, training, and job assignments are made without regard to race, color, national origin, age, ancestry, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, marital status, disability, or any other protected classification. We consider all qualified applicants, including those with criminal histories, in a manner consistent with state and local laws, including the City of Los Angeles' Fair Chance Initiative for Hiring Ordinance.

Senior Full Stack Engineer (JavaScript/React)
detail:
Senior Full Stack Engineer (JavaScript/React)

Job Description

Senior Software Engineer - CoStar - Richmond, VA

CoStar is looking for experienced Engineers to help grow our brand and business. CoStar's Engineering team is building the technology that facilitates 86% of the real estate transactions in the United States. These transactions range from a small business owner leasing their first office space to a large multi-national buying a new headquarters campus. On any given day our developers are building products that manage nearly a trillion dollars of potential real estate transactions.

WHY COSTAR?

It's simple, because we are continuing to grow! Our Richmond office, which is in the heart of the city, will soon expand from more than 1000 employees to triple that number. Being part of this growth translates to more teams, more projects, and more opportunities for you!

CoStar Group, Inc (NASDQ: CSGP) has the place for you! Whether it be Residential, Commercial office, Retail, Apartments, Land and even Business's themselves. We trach properties and provide consumers the data in realt time to ensure they are making the best decisions in finding, analyzing, and executing deals in all aspects of Real Estate. And we are #1 at what we do!

We are made up of Apartments.com, LoopNet.com, CoStar.com, BizBuySell, Homes.com, Ten-X and so much more!

We truly do value our tech teams with over $3 Billion invested in technology to date.

We also offer a highly competitive salary and benefits package including medical, dental, vision, life insurance, 401k, health and fitness incentives, education reimbursement an employee stock purchase plan and more.

BY THE NUMBERS

33 years of CRE Experience and constantly expanding into all aspects of real estate
4900 Employees (and counting)
75+ Offices in 13 countries
Almost 300% increase in our stock price in the past 5 years!
Transactions tracked annually of $1.5 Trillion
Annual Revenue of $1.66 Billion

THE TEAM

Our tech stack is modern and always evolving. Currently, we utilize a Micro Frontend Architecture with React, TypeScript, GraphQL, Elasticsearch NodeJS, Kubernetes, Docker, Azure DevOps, AWS and E2E testing with Cypress. Our microservice architecture includes .NET Core (C#), Kafka, SQL Server and MongoDB. We embrace CI/CD and are well on the way to being completely cloud based (AWS). You might not have experience in every area but if you have a drive to learn and grow, we encourage you to apply.

We're looking for a candidate who are energetic, self-motivated, team-oriented, and enjoy being a key contributor in an entrepreneurial environment. This isn't a task-receiving role; we want your hands, brains, and heart making solutions and shaping the platform's future.

RESPONSIBILITIES

Build big, distributed, API-driven systems for tens of thousands of users
Produce bullet-proof code that is robust, efficient and maintainable; our primary tools are C#, .NET Framework, JavaScript, AngularJS, JSON, SQL Server
Drive and lead software design, development standards, code reviews.
Continually evaluate emerging technologies to identify opportunities, trends, and best practices that can be leveraged to strength CoStar's technology platform and develop practices.
QUALIFICATIONS

Bachelor's Degree
5+ years experience in C#, .NET Framework
3+ years experience in MS SQL Server OR Database Design in T-SQL programming/performance tuning
Experience in architecting, designing and building large scale distributed, services-oriented systems and web applications in an agile environment
Data modeling experience
PREFERRED QUALIFCATIONS AND SKILLS (Nice to haves)

3+ years experience in JavaScript, ReactJS
Strong communication skills (to both business and technical partners
Advanced SQL Querying
Data modeling experience from conceptual, logical and physical designs
Experience with RESTful web services

#LI-CH1
#LI-Hybrid

CoStar Group is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer; we maintain a drug-free workplace and perform pre-employment substance abuse testing

CoStar Group is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer; we maintain a drug-free workplace and perform pre-employment substance abuse testing

McLean, VA 22102
Remote
description:
Piper Companies is seeking a Principal Software Architect to join an innovative Software Company. The Principal Software Architect will be working 100% remotely to produce innovative, business-enhancing solutions.





Responsibilities of the Principal Software Architect include:

Developing the technical vision and designs specifications of projects assigned and may perform as implementation lead
Define and implement architecture patterns to be used by development teams
Work with software engineering personnel, serving as a technical resource on a wide range of software design issues
Design and improve core software infrastructure, participating in the improvement the software development life cycle, technical operations, and technology innovation
Utilize analysis and simulation to perform systems and applications performance characterization and trade-off studies

Qualifications for the Principal Software Architect include:

10+ years of experience in Business Application Development and Solutions Architecture
Has architectural leadership experience with microservices and distributed applications
Possess strong technical background with LAMP, distributed web application architectures, Laravel, Node, Amazon native messaging, and cache technologies
Well versed with common distributed data tools in a production setting (Spark, Kafka, ete.)
Strong experience architecting and automating cloud native technologies, CI/CD workflows and configuration management platforms

Compensation for the Principal Software Architect include:

Salary Range:

o $180,000 – $190,000/year salary + bonus

Full Benefits: Unlimited PTO, Paid Holidays, Medical, Dental, Vision, 401k, etc

Qualifications for the Principal Software Architect include:

10+ years of experience in Business Application Development and Solutions Architecture
Has architectural leadership experience with microservices and distributed applications
Possess strong technical background with LAMP, distributed web application architectures, Laravel, Node, Amazon native messaging, and cache technologies
Well versed with common distributed data tools in a production setting (Spark, Kafka, ete.)
Strong experience architecting and automating cloud native technologies, CI/CD workflows and configuration management platforms

Compensation for the Principal Software Architect include:

Salary Range:

o $180,000 – $190,000/year salary + bonus

Full Benefits: Unlimited PTO, Paid Holidays, Medical, Dental, Vision, 401k, etc

description:
Job Description:


Performance Software is a medium-sized company with a great work/life balance, specializing in providing innovative embedded software to our client companies. We are looking for passionate Software Engineers who have done significant development work with Full Stack development. Very competitive hourly compensation and medical/dental and vision benefits are available. You can work from your home.




We are seeking a Senior Full Stack Software Engineer with a Back-End emphasis, who will be responsible for Cloud/Server based software development featuring the Linux, Postgres, Golang/C/C++, Swagger/RESTAPI, ReactJS. This role is expected to provide strong technical leadership and mentor less experienced members within the framework of an Agile software development team. The Senior Software Engineer must exhibit a strong sense of ownership regarding the technical solutions arrived at when implementing complex software designs. The work involves the full complement of software life cycle development activities required to deploy high quality software that meets the requirements of our aerospace customers.




Job Requirements:

Significant Full Stack development experience
U. S. Citizenship or Green Card holder
Significant experience with many of the following: Postgres, MySQL DB SQL, JSON, XML, Golang
Good verbal and written communication skills
Highly motivated and self-starting attitude
BS or advanced degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, or Computer Systems Engineering or equivalent development experience



Position Responsibilities:

Participate in software development activities including requirement specification, design definition, code implementation, system integration and test
Generate software lifecycle documentation to support certification of products
Integrate and debug Linux Server based software executing on Servers in Cloud based environments
Participate and contribute to Sprint Planning, Backlog grooming, Sprint Demos
Perform and/or provide guidance for verification activities including test definition, test development and testing methods
Work daily in Azure DevOps to do requirements analysis, requirement derivation, create User Stories and Task
Perform Code Reviews
Establish test frameworks to implement Continuous Integration/Continuous Delivery (CI/CD)
Enhance Linux based systems by studying the latest open-source software
Utilize avionics standards such as ARINC and RTCA in the development testing



About Performance:

Performance Software Corporation is engaged in the design of Real-time Embedded Software and Hardware. This includes Avionics and Space Exploration applications such as Synthetic Vision Cockpit Displays, Flight Management System Guidance and Navigation, Platforms, and Datalink Applications. Our customers are both Commercial and Defense-related avionics and rocketry suppliers/manufacturers. We have locations in Phoenix, AZ, New Orleans, LA, Grand Rapids, MI, Clearwater, FL, Bothell, WA, and Cedar Rapids, IA. We have been in business since 1998 and have been awarded INC Magazine 5000 Fastest Growing Companies and Best Places to Work for multiple years.




To learn more about us: https://www.psware.com/careers/




Performance Software Corporation is an affirmative action and equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, disability, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran status, or genetic information. Performance Software Corporation is committed to providing access, equal opportunity and reasonable accommodation for individuals with disabilities in employment, its services, programs, and activities. If you need reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and/or to receive other benefits and privileges of employment, please discuss this with your recruiter if you are selected for an interview.

title: FULL STACK DEVELOPMENT OPPORTUNITY (FULL-TIME) – 100% Remote
Lead Full Stack Engineer - REMOTE
detail:
Our premier client in the baking and financial industry is seeking to hire a Lead Full Stack Engineer to join their team as a full-time/ direct-hire employee to work 100% remote!

Important:
Remote
100% hands-on lead role
.NET or Node.js Full Stack + Azure (open to AWS but PREF to Azure)
Node.js
Front-end / UI (Vue.js is the target but flexible, open to Angular or React)
Need API and API integration experience is a plus. Build and integrate APIs

What is the opportunity?
The Lead Full Senior Engineer is a working lead that provides functional guidance and may coordinates the daily activities of individual contributors or working teams. The Lead also is an advanced senior professional with wide ranging experience who uses various concepts and in-depth evaluation to resolve complex issues in creative and effective ways. The Lead Full Stack Engineer develops and leads Team Member in developing both front-end and back-end solutions. Designs, develops, updates/maintains solutions and provides technical guidance to other Team Members. At this level the main challenge is to support junior Team Members to identify causes and implement solutions to complex business problems in a multifunctional project, assessing and communicating issues of technology impact on the business. The Lead Full Stack Engineer is a working lead, who solves complex problems, takes a broad perspective to identify solutions.
The colleague in this position would be comfortable with the following activities: Evaluates application software packages and makes recommendations to senior management. Lead & participates with other colleagues in new product reviews, tests, and pilots. Collects & in-depth analyzes business requirements for large projects. Performs in-depth feasibility studies, translates complex requirements into an appropriate design.

What will you do?
Provides technical guidance to Members of the Team May coordinate the daily activities of a team. Assigns tasks, set priorities. Serves as first point of contact to individual contributors before escalating to management. Help lead in the design and development of cross-functional, multi-platform application systems. Write great quality code with a drive for automated testing and validation based on the You Build You Own (YBYO) model.
Perform complex engineering activities for performance tuning, monitoring, deployment and production support. Research, influence and implement vendor dependency to simplify the architecture. Implement, maintain and update CI/CD pipelines on a cloud environment. Collaborate with business partners, architects and other groups to identify complex technical and functional needs of systems based on priority. Collaborate with multiple, enterprise-wide distributed performing teams to deliver new capabilities in business applications.
Design and develop APIs for Omni-channel clients.
Build APIs and UIs to help make use of large data sets, infrastructure, and user experience. Owns the full lifecycle for web software development, from ideas to production. Provides programming expertise and business analysis skills within broad business area, usually as a senior member of a project team, in analyzing, designing, modifying, and developing business applications. Creates and educates on programming specifications from which programs will be written, and designs, codes, tests, debugs, and documents programs. Create and review programming documentations and recommend changes in development, maintenance, and application standards. Analyzes and develops logical database designs, data models and relational data definitions across multiple computing environments (e.g., host based, distributed systems, client server, etc.) Complies with architectural standards and established methodologies and practices.

What do you need to succeed
Must-Have*
Bachelor's Degree or equivalent
Minimum of 7+ years of software development experience
Minimum of 7+ years of experience: Java, .NET, Python
Minimum of 7+ years coordinating team efforts in a project or operations environment
Minimum of 5+ years experience with databases and data modeling / design (SQL and NoSQL)
Minimum of 5+ years in full stack development for cloud solutions (Azure or AWS) - Azure preferred

For immediate consideration please submit your resume in Word format, along with daytime contact information. Client is unable to provide H-1B Visa sponsorship at this time. All submittals will be treated confidentially. Selected candidate may be asked to pass a comprehensive background, credit and/or drug screening. Principals only, no third parties please.

Established in 2000, Atrilogy Solutions Group, Inc. provides organizations of all sizes with high-quality, cost effective information technology (IT) and business process consulting & staffing services. Our industry-leading service model combines experienced project managers with seasoned technical and functional consultants to eliminate client uncertainty and deliver superior value and results.

Clients turn to Atrilogy for expertise in:
IT staffing and placement (Project Managers, Agile/Scrum Masters, Business Analysts, DBA's, Software Engineers, Mobile Developers (iOS, Android), DevOps, Automation, QA, Systems & Network Engineers, Cyber Security / Information Security Specialists)
All major ERP & CRM packages (including Oracle, Workday, PeopleSoft, JD Edwards, Lawson, SAP, Dynamics AX, Salesforce, Microsoft CRM, NetSuite)
Business Intelligence, Data Warehousing, and Big Data Integration
Creative (Interactive Project Manager/Art Director, Information Architect, UI/UX Designer, Web/Graphic Design)

Atrilogy has been recognized by Inc. magazine as one of the nation's fastest-growing, privately-held companies. Headquartered in Irvine, California, Atrilogy also has offices in Denver, Phoenix, Atlanta, and Dallas with satellite offices in Boston, Jersey City, Las Vegas, Seattle, and Delhi, India.

Atrilogy Solutions Group is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, protected veteran status, or any other basis protected by applicable law, and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.

In compliance with federal law, all persons hired will be required to verify identity and eligibility to work in the United States and to complete the required employment eligibility verification document form upon hire.
