Identification and contact information, and related identifiers such as full name, date and place of birth, citizenship and permanent residence, home and business addresses, telephone numbers, email addresses, and such information about your beneficiaries or emergency contacts.
Professional or employment-related information, including:
Recruitment, employment, or engagement information such as application forms and information included in a resume, cover letter, or otherwise provided through any application or engagement process; and copies of identification documents, such as driver's licenses, passports, and visas; and background screening results and references.
Career information such as job titles; work history; work dates and work locations; information about skills, qualifications, experience, publications, speaking engagements, and preferences; and professional memberships
Education Information such as institutions attended, degrees, certifications, training courses, publications, and transcript information.
Legally protected classification information such as race, sex/gender, religious/ philosophical beliefs, gender identity/expression, sexual orientation, marital status, military service, nationality, ethnicity, request for family care leave, political opinions, and criminal history.
Other information such as any information you voluntarily choose to provide in connection with your job application.

How We Use Personal Information

We collect, use, share, and store personal information from job applicants for our and our service providers' business and operational purposes in the recruitment process such as: processing your application, tracking your application through the recruitment process, contacting references with your authorization, conducting background checks you authorize, and making hiring decisions. We will also use job applicant information for internal analysis purposes to understand the applicants who apply and to improve our recruitment process. We may sometimes need to use applicant information for legal purposes, such as in connection with any challenges made to our hiring decisions.

With Whom We Share Personal Information

We will disclose job applicant personal information to the following types of entities or in the following circumstances (where applicable):

Internally: to other Legion personnel involved in the recruiting and hiring process.
Vendors: such as technology service providers, travel management providers, human resources suppliers, background check companies, and employment agencies or recruiters, where applicable.
Legal Compliance: when required to do so by law, regulation, or court order or in response to a request for assistance by the police or other law enforcement agency.
Litigation Purposes: to seek legal advice from our external lawyers or in connection with litigation with a third party.
Business Transaction Purposes: in connection with the sale, purchase, or merger.
How to Contact Us About this Policy – If you have any questions about this Policy, please contact privacy@legion.co.

title: Senior Full Stack Engineer / Node
Full Stack Engineer (Senior or Lead)
detail:
A shop based out of McLean, VA that is rearchitecting and updating their platform and doing full cloud migration. This would be a full-time opportunity and although it is based out of McLean, VA, they are open to remote. The tech stack they are using is Java, AWS, JavaScript, and Kubernetes.

They are looking to hire a Senior Full Stack Engineer to join their new team. The company is known for being the worldwide leader in global visa and immigration solutions. Their customers include employees of some of the world's largest corporations, tour operators, travel management companies, cruise lines, and much more.

Does this sound like the perfect fit and opportunity for you? Apply today to be considered!!
Required Skills & Experience
B.S. in Computer Science or a related field
Java 8+ experience
Experience working with JavaScript
Experience working with Docker, Jenkins, or Kubernetes
Extensive experience working in an AWS environment
Multiple years of experience leading/mentoring less tenured engineers
Excellent written/communication skills
Desired Skills & Experience
Experience working in a fast-paced environment
Management level experience, building out teams
What You Will Be Doing
Daily Responsibilities

80% Hands On
Effectively oversee a team of 2-4 engineers
Work on design features and application delivery plans
Implement relevant software experience to create best practices and faster development cycles
Provide effective code reviews and technical feedback
The Offer
You will receive the following benefits:

Medical Insurance
Dental Benefits
Vision Benefits
Flexible PTO plan
Offer yearly bonus up to 15%

Applicants must be currently authorized to work in the US on a full-time basis now and in the future.

title: Full Stack Engineer (Senior or Lead)
Remote Senior Full Stack Engineer
detail:
Are you a Full Stack Engineer with advanced experience?

Well, we are hiring Full Stack Engineers to work Fully Remote!!!!

Come join a team starting in 2011, that has rapidly grown to over 300 employees in just about 10 years. This company is transforming the technology world by making, monetizing your content easier than ever! This is made possible by a data image and analytics app that allows users to shop directly from social media sites. Allowing more than 100,000 premium fashion, beauty, fitness, home and lifestyle brands, creators and shoppers to collaborate while also making money. This app has already connected thousands with a full-service world-class platform to make social content easily accessible for all influencers and their followers everywhere!

We are currently looking to fill several different engineering roles both on the Front End and Back End side, as well as Full Stack Engineers! As a Full Stack Engineer, you will design and develop new features and scale for growth with your small local team building highly scalable cloud-native and mobile solutions. As a Senior Full Stack Engineer, you will take ownership of features and functionality across the full stack. You will also learn to master new languages, frameworks, and platforms (Golang, Javascript, Vue.JS docker, AWS).

Required Skills & Experience

6+ years of software development experience.
6+ years of experience in either frontend, backend (Golang, C or C++) or full stack development role.
Experience with a modern JavaScript framework (e.g. Vue, Angular, React) - Vue.js preferred
Experience working in a containerized environment, preferably Docker
Experience integrating 3rd party API's (REST, OAuth).

Desired Skills & Experience

Bachelors in Computer Science or equivalent experience
Experience with AWS systems such as ECS, Lambda, and RDS
Experience with EMR, Redshift, S3, Glue ETL (Scala), Athena
Experience with eCommerce platforms like Shopify and BigCommerce.
Experience designing or building cart and checkout systems.
The Offer
Heavily subsidized medical, dental and vision
Flexible PTO and work hours including some remote work options
Company Match 401k

Applicants must be currently authorized to work in the US on a full-time basis now and in the future.

title: Remote Senior Full Stack Engineer
Lead Senior Full Stack Engineer
detail:
Lead Senior Full Stack Software Engineer - $100-120k Base + Benefits - Hybrid Work Schedule - York PA - Civil Process Solutions Software Company

This Jobot Job is hosted by: Mike Landers
Are you a fit? Easy Apply now by clicking the "Apply Now" button and sending us your resume.
Salary: $100,000 - $120,000 per year

A bit about us:

My Client has been in software development since 1997 with a focus on County Offices since 2006. With 15 years of domain knowledge, they are focused on delivering results through software and strategies that have a meaningful impact year-over-year.

They provide county government organizations with easy-to-use software to enhance your workflows and organizational efficiency. Their technology solutions allow for enhanced data insights, improved work processes, and streamlined customer service. They see their clients as partners, not customers. Ongoing support and training are the basis of how we operate. They understands the complexity of local government operations with our level of experience.

Why join us?

If you have the skill and desire to work in a place where leaders listen and genuinely care, a place that pushes you to grow personally and professionally, and a place where you can put down roots and build a future, then my client just might be the home for you!

They offer:
Competitive base salary
a robust benefits package
401k
Ample PTO
The ability to grow professionally and promote from within
Many more perks that come with working in a small startup environment!

Job Details

We are looking for a Full-Stack Software Engineer with 7+ years of real-world experience. You will be a crucial member of one of our Product Teams, driving new and existing product development within an Agile Scrum environment. You will be expected to:

Collaborate with the Product Owner as the Engineering Team Lead to analyze and understand user stories, use cases, and requirements
Work directly with the Chief Engineer to mentor team members and ensure adherence to best practices
Design, develop, troubleshoot, and unit-test
Communicate clearly and proactively, both verbally and in writing
Estimate work accurately and produce deliverables on time

Qualifications
Applicants must have strong proficiency with the following tools and technologies:

C#, JavaScript, T-SQL
.NET / .NET Core
ASP.NET MVC
IIS, SQL Server

Bonus Points

Experience with the following will help you stand out!

React
jQuery
TypeScript
Web API
Entity Framework
DevExpress Reporting
Azure DevOps
Git
Front-end state management

Interested in hearing more? Easy Apply now by clicking the "Apply Now" button.

detail:
Senior Full Stack Software Engineer needed for a $150M Unicorn startup!

This Jobot Job is hosted by: Sydney Weaver
Are you a fit? Easy Apply now by clicking the "Apply Now" button and sending us your resume.
Salary: $120,000 - $185,000 per year

A bit about us:

Startup in the fintech space that is revolutionizing how employees can take advantage of equity before their company goes public. Their platform allows other folks to sell their private shares, employers can reward shareholders with pre-IPO liquidity and individual and institutional investors can participate in private unicorn growth. Currently used by some of the fastest-growing tech companies in the world like Space X, Palantir, etc

Their software engineering team is passionate about innovation and building scalable solutions that drive liquidity and growth in the private market. Their teams are leveraging a broad range of new technologies and are well-versed in delivering high quality, innovative solutions. We thrive on moving fast, delivering value, and living our values of being bold, humble and accountable.

Why join us?

We just went IPO and launched our Data Intelligence platform! You will be taking the real-time transaction data to market place to serve traders and analysts at VC hedge funds. Very competitive benefits package + bonus + RSU Package!

Job Details

The ideal candidate thrives in team settings, enjoys pair programming, and focuses on delivering value.

Responsibilities:

Design, implement, and maintain data-driven web applications.
Mentor members of the development team on internal and external frameworks, software development best practices, and new technologies.
Be able to gather requirements and plan actionable tasks for the team.
Collaborate with Forge's product, design, information security and business team members.
Design, build and maintain automated unit and integration tests.
Develop concise, articulate and detailed documentation
Support healthy system operations and ensure high levels of availability are achieved. Be part of the on-call rotation during business hours.

Requirements:

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or equivalent years of working experience in the field.
3+ years of full-stack software engineering experience with modern language (Ruby on Rails or Node are a big plus)
Experience developing multi-tier web applications using modern techniques.
Proven track-record of teamwork and delivery
Must be able to sit and/or stand for long periods of time in an office setting while working

Nice to have:

Experience developing in React is a plus
Experience with Event-Driven architectures a big plus
Fintech or Financial services industry experience
Experience with multiple programming languages
Experience mentoring junior software engineers
Experience at high-growth, venture-backed startups
Working knowledge of the private market
Working knowledge of financial regulators and their concerns

title: Senior Full Stack Software Engineer
Senior Full Stack Engineer, Backstage
subTitle:
Spotify
69 reviews
New York, NY
Remote
description:
Engineering
Developer Tools & Infrastructure
We are looking for a collaborative Senior Full Stack Engineer to join our Backstage product team, focused on creating the best developer experience for Spotify, the open source community and commercial partners.

Location

New York or Remote Americas

Job type

Permanent
The Backstage squads are functions within the Platform Developer Experience family aiming to:
Deliver an open and thriving ecosystem trusted by millions of engineers, one where hundreds of companies collaborate to build the best developer experience in the world.
Lead Spotify into a new era of infrastructure based on an open foundation, bringing an industry leading developer experience.


By joining us, you will help play an instrumental role in improving the experience of over 2000+ developers at Spotify as well as a growing open source community. Directly helping Spotify on our journey towards becoming one of the top tech companies in the world.

What you'll do

Work as part of a multi-functional team on Backstage across the whole development stack, solving problems at scale for both our internal and open source end users
Build and operate infrastructure, toolset and deployment pipelines
Take operational responsibility for the services that are owned by your team, potentially including taking part in an on-call rotation
Work in an environment that supports your individual growth
Advocate for unification of infrastructure, tools and languages where clients are similar in structure to lower the cost of ownership and increase the speed of the adopting teams
You’ll collaborate with other engineers, product managers, and designers to identify and solve challenging problems, creating an exciting engineering experience for our open-source community and internal Spotify engineering teams

Who you are

You enjoy working with React, TypeScript and Java and have a solid understanding of GraphQL and interacting with backend systems
You are experienced in building and implementing large-scale systems across various projects
As a contributor, you have engaged with large scale open-source projects
You know and care about sound engineering practices like continuous delivery, defensive programming and automated testing
You’re familiar with designing and building distributed and scalable systems and enjoy seeing millions of users running your code
You have good understanding of data structures and algorithms, and understand how to apply them to design pragmatic solutions
Mentoring and supporting peers and engineering teams, fostering the best engineering practices, is important to you
You have impact through your communication skills and love sharing your knowledge with others, helping them grow

Where you'll be

We are a distributed workforce enabling our band members to find a work mode that is best for them!
Where in the world? For this role, it can be within the East coast Americas in which we have a work location and is within working hours.
Prefer an office to work from home instead? Not a problem! We have plenty of options for your working preferences. Find more information about our Work From Anywhere options here

Our global benefits

Extensive learning opportunities, through our dedicated team, GreenHouse.
Flexible share incentives letting you choose how you share in our success.
Global parental leave, six months off - fully paid - for all new parents.
All The Feels, our employee assistance program and self-care hub.
Flexible public holidays, swap days off according to your values and beliefs.
Spotify On Tour, join your colleagues on trips to industry festivals and events.

Learn about life at Spotify

Spotify is an equal opportunity employer. You are welcome at Spotify for who you are, no matter where you come from, what you look like, or what’s playing in your headphones. Our platform is for everyone, and so is our workplace. The more voices we have represented and amplified in our business, the more we will all thrive, contribute, and be forward-thinking! So bring us your personal experience, your perspectives, and your background. It’s in our differences that we will find the power to keep revolutionizing the way the world listens.

Spotify transformed music listening forever when we launched in 2008. Our mission is to unlock the potential of human creativity by giving a million creative artists the opportunity to live off their art and billions of fans the chance to enjoy and be passionate about these creators. Everything we do is driven by our love for music and podcasting. Today, we are the world’s most popular audio streaming subscription service with a community of more than 381 million users.

Global COVID and Vaccination Disclosure
Spotify is committed to safety and well-being of our employees, vendors and clients. We are following regional guidelines mandating vaccination and testing requirements, including those requiring vaccinations and testing for in-person roles and event attendance. For the US, we have mandated that all employees and contractors be fully vaccinated in order to work in our offices and externally with any third-parties. For all other locations, we strongly encourage our employees to get vaccinated and also follow local COVID and safety protocols.

This role is not eligible for hire in Colorado, USA.

detail:
Job Description
A company in the hospitality space is hiring for a Full Stack Java Engineer. You'll work on enterprise software applications for their Loyalty and Rewards program, building microservices from scratch. This is a remote-hybrid opportunity with 2 days in office in Scottsdale.

If you've been looking to stretch your leadership skills and grow, this is a great opportunity to lead from the technical front and move into a Lead Developer role. You'll work in a mission-critical, modern software environment, using AWS, Java and React.
Required Skills & Experience
4+ years software engineering experience using Java 8 or higher
Experience building REST APIs from scratch
Experience with microservices
Experience working in cloud environments such as AWS, Google Cloud Platform, OCI, PCF
Desired Skills & Experience
Bachelor's degree in computer science or related field
Experience working in mission-critical or high transaction environments
Experience with CI/CD a plus
What You Will Be Doing
Tech Breakdown

100% New Development
The Offer
Bonus Eligible for Senior roles

Medical Insurance

detail:
We are seeking a Senior Full Stack Engineer to join a well recognized financial services corporation. This is a contract, remote capable role. As a Backend Engineer you will have an outsized impact and build the foundation for our financial service products that define the future of our company. You will work in an agile environment with service-oriented tech stack.

What You Will Do:



Build the foundation for their financial service products
Work in an agile environment with service-orientated tech stacks
Build full stack features from scratch
Collaborate and mentor current and future engineering members



What Gets You the Job:



Deep understanding of system design, data modeling and software architecture
Expertise in designing and implementing GraphQL and REST based API for omni-channel consumption (4 years) using Node.js
Strong experience and proficiency in TypeScript
Experience integrating 3rd party APIs
Comfortable building full-stack features from scratch Self-motivated with a high level of autonomy
Can work on a small team, in a fast-paced environment
At least 2 years of experience with TDD and BDD preferred
At least 2 years of experience with CICD preferred Experience in Azure or similar cloud platform is a huge plus



Please send your resume to Prashant Kholkar for immediate consideration

title: Senior Full Stack Engineer (Remote PST hours)
Senior Full Stack Software Engineer, Background Checks
subTitle:
Checkr
4 reviews
Denver, CO 80239
Remote
description:
Checkr's mission is to build a fairer future by designing technology to create opportunities for all. We believe all candidates, regardless of who they are, should have a fair chance to work. Established in 2014 and valued at $5B, Checkr is using technology to bring hiring to the next level. Our People Trust Platform uses machine learning to help thousands of companies modernize their background check process and make hiring safer, more efficient, and more inclusive. Some of our customers include Uber, Instacart, Doordash, Netflix, Compass Group, and Adecco.

A career with Checkr is an opportunity to work with some of the best and brightest minds, disrupt an industry for a better future, and give otherwise overlooked candidates access to employment. Checkr has been recognized in Forbes Best Startup Employers and is a top Y Combinator company by valuation.

We are looking for a Senior Full Stack Software Engineer to join the Background Check Program! The background check program is composed of the Criminal, Motor Vehicle, and Verifications teams. Our work involves orchestrating the flow of information from when a customer first places an order for a background check to interacting with data from thousands of sources to delivering the final report to customers and candidates. This is the core product and beating heart of Checkr.

As a member of the Verifications team, your focus will be on a wide product portfolio that includes Drug and Health Screenings, Employment and Education Verifications, and Professional License Verifications to name several in the product space, but also collaborating with the Criminal and Motor Vehicle team on cross-functional initiatives.

Because we process millions of records each year, every engineering challenge our group faces – compliance, data quality, speed, and reliability – is a challenge we face at scale. We also face deep product challenges from a highly fragmented and decentralized data ecosystem, which means every engineering choice we make is also an opportunity to reduce bias in the hiring process.

You will work in a collection of small services built on Ruby and Javascript, with both SQL and NoSQL databases, as well as message queues for asynchronous tasks. Checkr was founded by engineers for engineers; we want to create the best environment for developers to build, learn and love their work.

We are looking for teammates that are highly collaborative, enjoy pairing to solve problems, care deeply about the mission of our company (improving fairness in the criminal justice system), and are eager to work with a diverse team (42% of engineers across the background check program identify as women).

What you bring:

5+ years of software development experience
A preference towards collaboration, TDD, and pair programming
Experience writing performant, reliable, scalable, and secure code
Experience with microservices, queueing architectures, and APIs
Experience spearheading adoption of best practices for the entire team to improve code quality and velocity
Experience providing mentorship to junior engineers
Ruby experience or a desire to learn Ruby

What you get

A fast-paced and collaborative environment
Learning and development allowance
Competitive compensation and opportunity for advancement
100% medical, dental, and vision coverage
Up to 25K reimbursement for fertility, adoption, and parental planning services
Flexible PTO policy
Monthly wellness stipend, home office stipend

The base salary for this position will vary based on geography and other factors. In accordance with Colorado law, the base salary for this role if filled within Colorado is $129,200-$152,000.

Equal Employment Opportunities at Checkr
Checkr is committed to hiring talented and qualified individuals with diverse backgrounds for all of its tech, non-tech, and leadership roles. Checkr believes that the gathering and celebration of unique backgrounds, qualities, and cultures enriches the workplace.
Checkr also welcomes the opportunity to consider qualified applicants with prior arrest or conviction records. Checkr's commitment to diversity extends to hiring talented individuals in spite of a prior criminal history in accordance with local, state, and/or federal laws, including the San Francisco's Fair Chance Ordinance.

title: Senior Full Stack PHP Engineer / PHP-Laravel + VueJs
detail:
RX Marketing group is a California-based digital advertising company that employs our own state-of-the-art analytical and consumer intelligence platform to match people with the products they need to enrich their financial well-being.


We are looking for Senior Full Stack Engineers to join our engineering team to help support, improve and innovate new features and integrations in our consumer intelligence platform.

The ideal candidate will be a well-rounded Full Stack Engineer who strives in delivering high quality, high performing code, follows best practices and has deep knowledge of software design patterns. You are an individual that is highly motivated to work closely with our engineering teams to catch bugs, reduce technical debt, and ensure best practices & software development patterns.

You will be working 100% remote and should be extremely comfortable working via slack, google meet, zoom etc.

Benefits of working with us:

Unlimited PTO: Many organizations try this, but we do it successfully.
Paid Health Insurance, Dental, and Vision for you & your family: your family is our family.
Fully remote-work: You don't have to come to an office! Our team works over Slack, Google Meet, and Zoom.
401K Plan: Matching 100% of the first 4%
Company-provided hardware: We don’t want you to be held back by hardware - we provide the newest Apple hardware (MBP), extra monitors, and peripherals.
Employee education programs: Do you want to continue to learn and grow? We will pay for your training, courses, materials, and certifications.
Great Company Culture: Monthly Events (Poker, Guest Speakers, etc), Half Day Fridays (Summer time), and EOY “Quiet Time” (In December), 6 weeks paid parental leave.




What we expect out of every member of our software engineering team:

The ability to create a plan of attack on how you're going to accomplish the code you write in the form of flow diagrams, database schema ERD, and supporting documentation before you follow through on execution, execution is everything.
Eagerness to learn new technologies and excel at your technical core competencies.
We adhere to a high standard of engineering. Your code must be PSR12 compliant, maintain a high level of PHPUnit coverage. If it doesn't, it doesn't even make it into the development branch!
Be involved in our standups every morning, participate in team deep-dives that describe what we are making, join in on our Lunch & Learn to showcase a piece of technology you want us to adopt, and work with our project managers to stay on track and update our users!
Be organized and be able to communicate your objectives to your peers.
Positive and supportive team culture of diversity and growth.

RX Marketing's Tech Stack:

Code: PHP Laravel Framework 8+ and Vue/Nuxt
Infrastructure and DevOps: Ubuntu Linux, Kubernetes, Docker, Terraform, AWS & Google Cloud, and Sentry.
Databases: ElasticSearch, MongoDB, InfluxDB, Redis, and MySQL.
Version Control: GitHub & Gitlab
Project Tracking and Roadmaps: JIRA, Monday, and smart sheets. AGILE Scrum (eXtreme Programming).

Requirements:

At least 5+ years of experience as a Full Stack Engineer programming in PHP and Javascript.
Additionally, at least 2 years of experience using Vue and Laravel.
Expert Working knowledge of:
Architecture and Design Patterns
Design Patterns such as and not limited to Event Driven Development, Macro/Micro Services, PubSub Services, Interprocess Communication, Message Queues, Service Patterns.
Good understanding of application optimization at scale
Laravel Queues
Service Pattern
APIs
Laravel 8+
Service Container / Service Provider
Package Development
Facades
Events, Jobs, Middleware
REST best practices.
Git: Branching strategies, merge requests, conflict resolution, merge requests.
Unit, Feature Testing, and Integration Tests. (php unit, parallel testing)
Advanced Understanding of MySQL, and Redis.
Moderate Understanding of Vue architecture and best practices
Basic Understanding of data stores (Nuxt)
Advanced understanding of API operations and JS promises
Advanced understanding of stand alone components
Basic understanding of Docker / Command Line.
Basic understanding of modular development

Nice to haves:

Experience or have an understanding of:
Databases such as ElasticSearch, InfluxDB, MongoDB.
Laravel Queues, Events/Listeners, Workers, and Caching, Facades, etc.
Bootstrap, Tailwind, or other front-end UX/UI Frameworks.
Diagram tools like Lucidcharts, Diagrams.net, or equivalent.
Cypress, Cucumber or other frontend testing frameworks
Experience with high performance applications.
CI/CD application deployment in a cloud-based infrastructure such as Google Cloud Platform.
Good understanding and comfortable using Linux/Unix command line.

About You:

You have a Keen eye to discover deep rooted issues and provide improved solutions to problems.
Great communication skills.
You enjoy mentoring your peers.
Self-supervised.

Diagram tools like Lucidcharts, Diagrams.net, or equivalent.
Cypress, Cucumber or other frontend testing frameworks
Experience with high performance applications.
CI/CD application deployment in a cloud-based infrastructure such as Google Cloud Platform.
Good understanding and comfortable using Linux/Unix command line.

About You:

You have a Keen eye to discover deep rooted issues and provide improved solutions to problems.
Great communication skills.
You enjoy mentoring your peers.
Self-supervised.
title: Senior Full Stack PHP Engineer / PHP-Laravel + VueJs
Senior Software Engineer (Full Stack .NET, Technical Lead/Director level)
detail:
Who Are We?

Taking care of our customers, our communities and each other. That's the Travelers Promise. By honoring this commitment, we have maintained our reputation as one of the best property casualty insurers in the industry for over 160 years. Join us to discover a culture that is rooted in innovation and thrives on collaboration. Imagine loving what you do and where you do it.

Compensation Overview

The annual base salary range provided for this position is a nationwide market range and represents a broad range of salaries for this role across the country. The actual salary for this position will be determined by a number of factors, including the scope, complexity and location of the role; the skills, education, training, credentials and experience of the candidate; and other conditions of employment. As part of our comprehensive compensation and benefits program, employees are also eligible for performance-based cash incentive awards.

Salary Range
$117,500.00 - $193,900.00

Target Openings
1

What Is the Opportunity?
Travelers is seeking a full-stack Senior Software Engineer to join our organization as we grow and transform our Technology landscape. Individual will complete advanced software end to end engineering tasks that span many parts of a system including designing, developing, analyzing, configuring, testing, debugging, troubleshooting, documenting, health monitoring/alerting, and implementing based on user or system specifications. Individual will also consult with users to determine hardware, software or system functional specifications, manage the effective use of resources, act as subject matter expert across multiple applications, systems and technologies, leverage technical and business knowledge to drive the planning and execution of complex initiatives, participate in the design/ development process, and provide technical leadership.
Primary Job Duties & Responsibilities

Perform complex analysis, advanced level design, configuration and develop functions for impactful and high-visibility tasks.
Take the lead on directing and implementing solutions to moderately complex, loosely scoped problems that are aligned with team goals.
Deliver efforts both independently and by leading other team members.
Lead investigation and resolution efforts for critical, high impact problems, defects, and incidents.
Act as a technology advocate, independently seeking opportunities where technology can be utilized to improve the business.
Provide technical guidance and mentorship while fostering a team environment.
Apply knowledge of current industry trends and techniques to formulate solutions within the context of assigned efforts.
Seek opportunities to expand technical knowledge and capabilities.

Minimum Qualifications

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or a related field, or its equivalent in work experience.
Three years of programming/development experience.


Education, Work Experience, & Knowledge

Five years of programming/development experience preferred.
Application Design
Guidewire is a plus
Technical Leadership
CI/CD
Automated Testing
Microservices
Cloud
Agile


Job Specific Technical Skills & Competencies

Delivery - Advanced delivery skills including the ability to determine the software design strategy and methodology to be used for efforts, use automated tests, analysis, and informed feedback loops to ensure the quality and production readiness of work before release, monitor the health of work efforts and that of adjacent systems.
Domain Expertise - Demonstrated track record of domain expertise including the ability to develop business partnerships and influence priorities by identifying solutions that are aligned with current business objective and closely follow industry trends relevant to domain, understanding how to apply them, and sharing knowledge with coworkers.
Problem Solving - Strong problem solver who utilizes data and proofs of concepts to find creative solutions to difficult problems, reflects on solutions, measuring their impact, and uses that information to ideate and optimize. Also adept at making decisions that involve a significant number of factors with broad implications.
Communication - Strong communicator who possesses the ability to describe technology concepts in ways the business can understand, document initiatives in a concise and clear manner, collaborate effectively with teammates and others regardless of role, quickly extract core issues from discussions and meetings, give and receive constructive feedback, offer help when asked, and ensure everyone has a chance to share their thoughts and are heard; an attentive and empathetic listener.
Leadership - Advanced leadership skills with the ability to take action even when there is no clear owner, inspire and motivate others, and be effective at influencing team members.


Employment Practices

Travelers is an equal opportunity employer. We value the unique abilities and talents each individual brings to our organization and recognize that we benefit in numerous ways from our differences.

If you are a candidate and have specific questions regarding the physical requirements of this role, please send us an email so we may assist you.

Travelers reserves the right to fill this position at a level above or below the level included in this posting.

To learn more about our comprehensive benefit programs please visit http://careers.travelers.com/life-at-travelers/benefits/.

title: Informatica Technical Lead
detail:
About US - Xoriant is a Silicon Valley headquartered product engineering, software development, and technology services firm with offices in the U.S., Europe, and Asia. For both technology companies and enterprises, from start-ups to the Fortune 100, we leverage our expertise in emerging technologies and our high-performing teams to deliver innovative solutions that accelerate time to market and keep our clients competitive.

Job Title: Informatica Technical Lead
Work Location : Newport Beach, CA
Contract duration: 6

Job Description:
Minimum 8+ years of experience.
Must Have Skills in Informatica, Snowflake
Nice to have skills in Cloud technologies
Contribute in a senior level capacity to the design and development of ETL solutions using Informatica for RSD Data Integration DI projects and initiatives.
Translate project requirements into technical design and required ETL deliverables.
Collaborate with project analysts and data architect to create ETL high level and detail design mapping specifications in line with established standards.
Develop Informatica objects to meet the technical specification requirements.
Work directly with multiple client stakeholders from off shore as required.
Knowledge or Little Work Experience on Snowflake and its services
Status reporting – periodic
Experience with batch process ETL mapping
Experience with financial data
Ability to work with business and technology users to elicit requirements and refine mapping documents
Top 3 responsibilities you would expect the Subcon to shoulder and execute:
Contribute in a senior level capacity to the design and development of ETL solutions using Informatica for RSD Data Integration DI projects and initiatives.
Translate project requirements into technical design and required ETL deliverables.
Collaborate with project analysts and data architect to create ETL high level and detail design mapping specifications in line with established standards

title: Informatica Technical Lead
Principal Frontend Engineer (remote)
subTitle:
Recruiting From Scratch
Germantown, MD 20876
Remote
description:
Who is Recruiting from Scratch:

Recruiting from Scratch is a premier talent firm that focuses on placing the best product managers, software, and hardware talent at innovative companies. Our team is 100% remote and we work with teams across the United States to help them hire. We work with companies funded by the best investors including Sequoia Capital, Lightspeed Ventures, Tiger Global Management, A16Z, Accel, DFJ, and more.

About Our Client

Our client is looking for a Principal Frontend Engineer to join their team to help invent the future of data analytics. This role will be responsible for driving forward the frontend architecture and technical direction, with a special focus on designing new data and visualization primitives in the browser.

Our client is an early team so they’re still establishing large parts of their software stack - you will have major ownership over the product and you’ll help them pick the right technologies. They have a culture of autonomy and ownership and want engineers who are excited to drive the company forward. As an early employee you’ll help them craft their culture and will be aware of customer development and goto market.

What we look for
6+ years of software engineering experience with at least 3+ years as a senior/ principal/ staff engineer.
You love to build well-designed products that delight users and solve real problems.
You write high-quality, well-tested code and design interfaces that strike the right balance between simplicity and flexibilty.
You have deep technical expertise in modern web frameworks like React and have worked with browser-native data technologies like WebGL and Apache Arrow.
You love teaching other engineers and can be an effective mentor for both junior and senior teammates.
You're excited to push the limits of what modern browsers can do.
Bonus points for
Experience building data analytics applications.
Experience building products in a regulated field.
Experience using AWS services like S3, DynamoDB, and Cloudwatch.
Benefits: PTO, Health Services, and more
Base Salary Range: $160,000 to $230,000

detail:
100% REMOTE Principal Software Engineer - Rust experience required for Stablecoin-as-a-Service DeFi company - $160,000 to $250,000 base salary, performance bonus, meaningful equity, and benefits.

This Jobot Job is hosted by: Patrick Murray
Are you a fit? Easy Apply now by clicking the "Apply Now" button and sending us your resume.
Salary: $200,000 - $275,000 per year

A bit about us:

Our company connects Decentralized Finance (DeFi) on blockchains with traditional finance by making it easy to convert real world assets into digital representations! We are currently looking for a Staff Backend Software Engineer who has experience developing highly secure and resilient asynchronous web applications, and ideally has experience with financial or blockchain applications.

If you are a Senior Backend Software Developer with an interest in Blockchain/DeFi, please apply today to find out more.

Why join us?

Total Compensation Package:


Level: Principal Developer- Compensation: $180,000 - $250,000 + 0.3%-0.5%
Level: Senior Engineer - Compensation: $140,000 - $190,000 + 0.2%-0.35%
Telecommute (Work from home)
Performance Bonus
Comprehensive Benefits Package
Flexible Work Schedules
Accelerated Career Growth
Great PTO
Full-Time Position, Stable/Growing Company
Modern Environment
State of the Art DeFi Technology


Job Details

What you get to do every day:


Architect and develop full stack web applications with a small team
Writing reusable, testable, and efficient code
Make informed UI/UX decisions to create intuitive and confident user experiences
Own a product vertical and make informed product and technical decisions

What we look for:


7+ years of professional software development experience in strongly typed languages
Experience in Rust
Some experience in one of the following: Golang, Swift, TypeScript, or Python
Interest in cryptocurrency and blockchain technology
A desire to have great test coverage to enable continuous delivery


Interested in hearing more? Easy Apply now by clicking the "Apply Now" button.

title: Principal Software Engineer (100% Remote)
Full Stack Engineer
detail:
Apply for a Full Stack Engineer role with our Largest Financial Client.







Client Domain/Industry: (Information Technology) - Experis, a ManpowerGroup company has an exciting contract opportunity for a Full Stack Engineer. This position is a 06 to12-month Contract, for one of our key clients, a Fortune 500 American multinational Information Technology company.







Please send your updated resume to and I will be happy to have this moving swiftly.







Below is the job description:




Job Title: Full Stack Engineer




Client Location: Durham, NC




Duration: 06 to 12 Months Contract




This is fast moving requirement.




Monday to Friday normal business working hours.







As a Senior Software Engineer in the Operations Modernization Chapter, you will partner closely with business, operations & engineering teams to implement next generation technology solutions to transform our operational landscape.




You will be working with a global team of architects, analysts and developers using scrum methodology.




This is a hands-on role where you will understand the requirement, help with the designs, and write code.




You will adopt and contribute to modern software development practices.




You will be responsible to craft secure, scalable, resilient cloud-based services.




As a senior software engineer in the team, you may be tapped into for guiding junior engineers on the team.

description:
Job Description:
CSC Generation Holdings family of brands is saving Retail. We acquire store and catalog-based retailers, and transform them into high performing, “digital first” brands. In just four years, we’ve acquired and turned around brands including: Sur La Table, Z Gallerie, Direct Buy and One Kings Lane, saving thousands of jobs and reaching over a billion dollars in revenue.

As a Senior Full Stack Engineer (React), you will work on a team to build best-in-class microservices, business-facing user dashboards, and customer-facing experiences. Our senior full-stack engineers own the technical facets of our various services within our application cloud. We are building a constellation of API-and-SDK first, composable services, working to make our systems programmable and discoverable for other teams within the business. You should love quality abstractions, good systems design, and patterns as much as we do.

Your day to day responsibilities will include:

Work with product teams to architect and implement a service in our retail cloud
Design and implement in Typescript (we can teach you) / JS, React, on AWS
Building quality, functional code that you and your team can be proud of
Publish APIs, SDKs, and CLIs for your systems that other developers can use
Write responsive and functional components in React for the front-end
Learn and keep up with current best practices for elegant code and projects

Our ideal candidate is someone that:

Can work on both frontend and backend components of an application (if you're stronger on the frontend or backend, we'd still like to hear from you)
Can be the technical owner of an internally facing consumer microservice product
Has around 7+ years of experience, in areas of our tech stack: Typescript, Javascript, Node, React, AWS (ie: Lambda, CloudFront, CodePipeline, this one is trainable)
Strong sense of ownership for the entire software lifecycle, not only to the next handoff
Believe in finding the best solution, not just one that works

What's in it for you:

Career growth opportunities with a rapidly growing company!
Work with and learn from top technical talent
See the impact and scope of your work clearly and directly
Competitive comp package
Don't worry, we won’t ask you to go back into the office. Work remotely indefinitely! :)
Unlimited PTO (For US employees)

CSC Generation provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

description:
This position is responsible for helping design, implement and support highly available cloud solutions leveraging Azure cloud services.

Key activities will focus on the daily support of MissionSquare’s Azure environment, including the monitoring of existing cloud infrastructure, configuration of cloud settings and features, tier 2/3 end-user support of issues that are escalated from the MissionSquare ServiceDesk, investigation of operationally escalated security incidents, cloud reporting and environmental analysis, and completion of assigned project tasks and activities for all cloud components.

This role also requires excellent collaboration skills and will need to frequently interact with cloud architects, senior infrastructure engineers, enterprise security analysts, ServiceDesk personnel, and technical leadership to achieve the corporate goals of high availability, performance, stability, scalability, security, and cost efficiency.

Essential Functions for this role include:

Hands-on experience of installation, configuration, and troubleshooting of Windows Server operating systems, Active Directory, Microsoft DNS and Microsoft Certificates.

Support MissionSquare cloud services leveraging tools such as Defender for Cloud, Monitor, Sentinel, Logic Apps, ARM Templates, Azure Migrate.

Hands-on experience deploying Microsoft Azure environments, including hybrid scenarios, optimizing cost/capacity ratios, proper monitoring, scaling, implementing, DR scenarios, and Azure security.

Experience with Azure Storage, Azure Virtual Machines, Azure Virtual Desktop, Azure SQL and Azure Networking technologies.

Communicate effectively with infrastructure architects and engineers, developers, project managers, security engineers, and senior management.

Monitor and report on project activities and report to the team and management regarding project status, task, and issues/risks.

Experience with security baselines, security incidents, and continual security improvements.

Assist in proactively identifying process improvement opportunities by challenging conventional practices and adopting new methods to increase future state agility, flexibility, and security.

If you have the following credentials, we encourage you to apply:

7+ years of experience supporting cloud infrastructure and applications preferably within the financial services industry.

Microsoft Certified: Azure Solutions Architect Expert required

subTitle:
RPO International
Remote
Remote
description:
Summary:
As a Senior full-stack engineer, you will start as a one-man team on this brand-new client product to be launched soon. The plan is to ramp up & build a product team by the end of '22. The immediate requirement for this role is to refactor the prototype code developed by one of Client Vendor Partner to make it production ready by incorporating clients engineering patterns & deploying the code on Digital Platforms (Cloud, API & Data platforms)

As a Senior full-stack engineer who is a self-starter, comes with Cloud Tech experience & background. This person will have the ability to work closely with the business to understand needs & value of building this product, working with an agile/DevOps mindset.

Responsibilities:

As a Software Engineer (contractor) for NA Digital Solutions, you are an experienced and motivated hands-on engineer with strong technical capabilities and possess proven software engineering skills to achieve results as a member of an agile team.
You will participate in the architecture, design, development, and support of digital solutions in our digital portfolio, currently being developed.
In this role you will join a passionate, empowered agile engineering team that discovers and delivers solutions to complex problems and enables client's digital future.
You are comfortable managing competing priorities and can bring order to ambiguous scenarios.
You will contribute sound architectural, engineering and security practices to ensure your solutions are scalable, resilient, and robust.
Develop, test, integrate, maintain, and troubleshoot software solutions using sound software engineering patterns and principles
Develop testable code with attention to code quality and incorporates security practices in newly developed and maintained applications
Create libraries and application programming interface to automate components of the continuous integration delivery platform using appropriate system level language to help automate customer use cases.
Be a part of an agile team, adopt agile philosophies, participate / facilitate agile ceremonies, and contribute towards continuous improvement through feedback
Participate in peer code reviews both as a submitter and coach as a reviewer providing feedback to engineers
Incorporate client's engineering and development best practices for the full software development lifecycle, including coding standards, code reviews, source control management, build processes, testing, and security principles to deliver high-quality code rapidly

Qualifications:

Python & related tech for backend work, Angular frontend work, PgSQL with Flyway,
Full stack experience with ability to switch between front-end & backend work as needed.
Experience working on web technologies - front-end or server-side development, database / SQLs a plus
Experience practicing DevOps engineering principles such as continuous integration/continuous development, test automation with unit testing and code coverage
Experience implementing application security
Knowledge of using development standards to build secure and quality code
Knowledge of working on cloud technologies or cloud native development
Deep knowledge and understanding of Git based version control system with strategies around branching, releases, and deployments

Preferred

Prior experience in Risk Management

If you have the described qualifications and are interested in this exciting opportunity, apply ASAP!

Whether you are looking for contract, contract-to-hire, or permanent positions, let's connect today!

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: Up to $70.00 per hour

Schedule:

8 hour shift

Experience:

Python: 5 years (Preferred)
Angular frontend work: 3 years (Preferred)
PgSQL with Flyway: 3 years (Preferred)
Git based version control system: 3 years (Preferred)
Risk Management: 1 year (Preferred)

Work Location: Remote

description:
Overview:
SRI International, an over 75-year strong pioneering research institute, has a rich history supporting government and industry. Our innovations have created new industries, billions of dollars in market value and lasting benefits to society. SRI is organized around broad disciplines and capabilities, with research and development divisions and labs to groups who excel at identifying new opportunities, developing products and creating custom solutions. Our organization is driven by impact - delivering unique solutions for the world's important challenges and transforming ideas into reality for clients and partners.
Responsibilities:
We seek a talented Principal Software Engineer. The ideal candidate should demonstrate a thorough understanding of engineering technology. Successful candidates will guide the technical design of products and systems; guide designs involving interdisciplinary teams in close cooperation with senior engineering management, program management and/or product line management. Will serve as an expert in assigned technical area, both internally and to represent the company externally.

Duties and Responsibilities:

Guide the technical design of products
Guide designs involving interdisciplinary teams in close cooperation with senior engineering management, program management and/or product line management.
Serve as an expert in assigned technical area, both internally and to represent the company externally. Not just from software view but from system level as well.
Review customer specifications and requirements, and develop designs to best support them, including cost as a key design variable
Provide budget, cost and schedule input for design assignments
Document component and subsystem specifications and material requirements
Analyze designs as necessary
Specify and evaluate supplier components, subsystems and services
Support the program design to cost and design for manufacture requirements
Communicate clearly (written and oral) with manufacturing, supply chain, program management and the customer as required
Participate heavily in preparation of the more complex and significant proposals
Provide technical expertise and assistance to other engineers and support personnel
Interact with technical management, other professionals, technicians and support personnel to coordinate, recommend and confer regarding technical activities and progress
May mentor and coach the work of others as assigned
Support, communicate, reinforce and defend the mission, values and culture of the organization
Qualifications:
Qualifications:

Master’s degree in computer science or engineering with a minimum of 10+ years of experience
15+ years of technical software design experience
Solid understanding of multi-threading/multi-processing
Strong development experience in C and C++
Proficient with Microsoft Office, including MS PowerPoint, MS Word and MS Excel
Motivated, self-starter individual
Comfortable working on new business development/advance program/new concept pursuits
Experience as a technical lead, providing expertise and assistance to other engineers and support personnel
Experience/ familiarity with networks, especially Ethernet architecture and associated protocols;
US Government Security Clearance desired, but not required
Must be able to travel

Desired Skills:

Development of algorithms relating to mathematical modeling, 2D and 3D transforms, georeferencing
Strong analytical and communication skills
Experience working with video, communication protocols, and mesh networking
Familiarity with national standards and formats such as Motion Imagery Standard Board (MISB) and Test and Engineering Enabling Architecture (TENA)
Experience with ISO and CMMI documentation and compliance
Lead and direct the work of others as assigned
Expert with modern software development processes, including software configuration management tools, defect tracking tools, and agile development life cycles.
Experience developing software in a Linux environment
Experience working with embedded systems and microcontrollers
Perform cyber security engineering tasks on systems including security implementation, testing, and mitigating issues from testing.
Analyze cyber security requirements and controls, support development of risk mitigation plans for vulnerability, and support certification and evaluation effort.
Support design and development of cyber security architecture and documentation.
Perform network scans with the existing network scanning tools.
Ability to analyze the system risks and vulnerabilities of devices on various networks
Ability to develop detailed cyber security architecture diagrams
Familiarity with the Department of Defense Information Assurance/Cyber Security requirements and certification processes beneficial
Familiarity with the Risk Management Framework (RMF) process a bonus

Xero

description:
Xero is a beautiful, easy-to-use platform that helps small businesses and their accounting and bookkeeping advisors grow and thrive.

At Xero, our purpose is to make life better for people in small business, their advisors, and communities around the world. This purpose sits at the centre of everything we do. We support our people to do the best work of their lives so that they can help small businesses succeed through better tools, information and connections. Because when they succeed they make a difference, and when millions of small businesses are making a difference, the world is a more beautiful place.

About the role

As the Principal Engineer, you'll help engineering teams to deliver better software to Xero's customers faster. You'll regard engineering teams as your customers, and test, measure and learn how best to provide them value.

You'll set the standard for engineering and operational excellence at Xero and educate teams in what those standards are, how to recognize them and how to reach them along with explaining and promoting world-class engineering at Xero.
About you
You'll have a track record of innovating and delivering technology at scale.
You will bring extensive experience in operating complex technology systems in production.
Proven experience in operating at a senior technical level.
A growth mindset.
You understand that competency is not fixed but is enhanced through dedication and hard work.
Great communication skills, who listens and observes in detail to build real understanding.
What you'll be responsible for
Working to understand the operational challenges of teams across Xero and contribute your expertise to delivering and refining strategy within your group.
Having a handle on roadmaps and upcoming technology challenges, guiding teams to navigate them successfully.
Working closely with senior engineers to develop their skills and increase their value to their teams.
Seeking out and quantifying cross-cutting problems that hinder development teams' ability to deliver and operate software successfully.
Identify and interpret external research and practices to help guide Xero’s engineering practices.
Leading efforts to deliver solutions to those problems with product development teams
Championing and driving engineering principles and practices.
Scaling and evolving working solutions across multiple teams
Contributing to industry-wide practice improvement.

This role will involve on-call availability and periodic overtime. If you are ready to take on a new challenge in a fast-paced organization where the sky's the limit we want to hear from you!
Xero is an equal opportunity employer. Xero celebrates diversity. We are committed to creating an inclusive environment where our employees can do the best work of their lives.



We are committed to transparency and to equal pay for equal work. Total compensation for this role includes a base salary of $165,000 - $175,000, commensurate with experience, plus an annual grant of Xero shares, calculated as a percentage of base salary.



In addition to base salary and long-term incentive, this position also has variable compensation/commission.

Xero offers access to low-cost, high-quality health care options through Cigna and Kaiser (in CA & CO only)
Xero will match 100% on the first 3% of 401k contributions plus 50% match on next 2% of contributions
Employees enjoy 21 days of paid time off per year
Employees have 10 days of wellbeing leave to care for their minds, bodies, and families
US employees enjoy 11 paid holidays per year
Xero offers an industry-leading 26 weeks of parental leave up to 100% pay
Xero offers a number of employee wellness programs, to include yoga, mindfulness and nutrition workshops, EAP, free flu shots, team meals, and a monthly wellbeing allowance

Why Xero?

Diversity of people brings diversity of thought, and we like that. A collaborative and inclusive environment is important to us. Working at Xero will provide you with a diverse and inclusive environment alongside people who will respect, challenge and support you to have fun while you do the best work of your life. We are a place where personal development, flexible working, innovation, and well-being are not just inspired but celebrated. We value our people and offer a wide range of compelling benefits and perks, including Xero shares and great parental leave policies.

Xero’s collaborative culture is underscored by our values - #Ownership, #Challenge, #Beautiful, #Human and #Team - which empower us to understand and serve customers, attract top talent and continuously innovate. From the moment you step through our doors, you’ll feel welcome and supported to do the best work of your life.

Xero strongly encourages employees and contractors to be vaccinated against COVID-19 in order to work from a Xero office, or engage in any face-to-face Xero business.

description:
Xero is a beautiful, easy-to-use platform that helps small businesses and their accounting and bookkeeping advisors grow and thrive.

At Xero, our purpose is to make life better for people in small business, their advisors, and communities around the world. This purpose sits at the centre of everything we do. We support our people to do the best work of their lives so that they can help small businesses succeed through better tools, information and connections. Because when they succeed they make a difference, and when millions of small businesses are making a difference, the world is a more beautiful place.

About the role

As the Principal Engineer, you'll help engineering teams to deliver better software to Xero's customers faster. You'll regard engineering teams as your customers, and test, measure and learn how best to provide them value.

You'll set the standard for engineering and operational excellence at Xero and educate teams in what those standards are, how to recognize them and how to reach them along with explaining and promoting world-class engineering at Xero.
About you
You'll have a track record of innovating and delivering technology at scale.
You will bring extensive experience in operating complex technology systems in production.
Proven experience in operating at a senior technical level.
A growth mindset.
You understand that competency is not fixed but is enhanced through dedication and hard work.
Great communication skills, who listens and observes in detail to build real understanding.
What you'll be responsible for
Working to understand the operational challenges of teams across Xero and contribute your expertise to delivering and refining strategy within your group.
Having a handle on roadmaps and upcoming technology challenges, guiding teams to navigate them successfully.
Working closely with senior engineers to develop their skills and increase their value to their teams.
Seeking out and quantifying cross-cutting problems that hinder development teams' ability to deliver and operate software successfully.
Identify and interpret external research and practices to help guide Xero’s engineering practices.
Leading efforts to deliver solutions to those problems with product development teams
Championing and driving engineering principles and practices.
Scaling and evolving working solutions across multiple teams
Contributing to industry-wide practice improvement.

This role will involve on-call availability and periodic overtime. If you are ready to take on a new challenge in a fast-paced organization where the sky's the limit we want to hear from you!
Xero is an equal opportunity employer. Xero celebrates diversity. We are committed to creating an inclusive environment where our employees can do the best work of their lives.



We are committed to transparency and to equal pay for equal work. Total compensation for this role includes a base salary of $165,000 - $175,000, commensurate with experience, plus an annual grant of Xero shares, calculated as a percentage of base salary.



In addition to base salary and long-term incentive, this position also has variable compensation/commission.

Xero offers access to low-cost, high-quality health care options through Cigna and Kaiser (in CA & CO only)
Xero will match 100% on the first 3% of 401k contributions plus 50% match on next 2% of contributions
Employees enjoy 21 days of paid time off per year
Employees have 10 days of wellbeing leave to care for their minds, bodies, and families
US employees enjoy 11 paid holidays per year
Xero offers an industry-leading 26 weeks of parental leave up to 100% pay
Xero offers a number of employee wellness programs, to include yoga, mindfulness and nutrition workshops, EAP, free flu shots, team meals, and a monthly wellbeing allowance

Why Xero?

Diversity of people brings diversity of thought, and we like that. A collaborative and inclusive environment is important to us. Working at Xero will provide you with a diverse and inclusive environment alongside people who will respect, challenge and support you to have fun while you do the best work of your life. We are a place where personal development, flexible working, innovation, and well-being are not just inspired but celebrated. We value our people and offer a wide range of compelling benefits and perks, including Xero shares and great parental leave policies.

Xero’s collaborative culture is underscored by our values - #Ownership, #Challenge, #Beautiful, #Human and #Team - which empower us to understand and serve customers, attract top talent and continuously innovate. From the moment you step through our doors, you’ll feel welcome and supported to do the best work of your life.

Xero strongly encourages employees and contractors to be vaccinated against COVID-19 in order to work from a Xero office, or engage in any face-to-face Xero business.

description:
Senior Software Engineer for growing company - Kubernetes Guru please apply:

https://www.ampd.io/ - This is a remote/work from home opportunity!

We are currently the only company connecting Google and Amazon with a fully automated ad platform. This is a software developer's dream. Not only will you be joining a company growing over 200% month over month right now, you will be using your talents to make a real-world impact for millions of people.

At Ampd, we are transforming the way that brands and businesses reach their customers. We build simple, intuitive products backed by revolutionary data-driven technology to empower companies to cut through the complexity of digital advertising and focus on building their business. We currently have an unparalleled solution for Amazon sellers wanting to use Google Ads that is quickly gaining traction and momentum, and we want to push to the next level!

We believe we are living in a unique moment in time, with an explosion of small-to-medium sized ecommerce businesses that could benefit from the right data and insights to better connect with their target audience. Our ad automation algorithms help these business owners and marketers measurably increase their revenue with the click of a button.

Join our small, passionate team that takes pride in software excellence and elegance. We get things done quickly so the software you develop will help people without delay. We are looking for a software expert to join us in transforming the realm of digital advertising, unlocking a complex industry for the common advertiser.


Why we need you:

Digital advertising is a sophisticated space with an enormous amount of data. It can be overwhelming for an inexperienced marketer. We have combined our marketing domain knowledge with computational power, slashing through the complexity so end users can more easily grow their businesses.




We need your background and understanding to develop reliable and extensible systems that anticipate the rapidly changing advertising ecosystem. We value your flexibility and speed, working up and down the stack and creating elegant experiences for our customers and engineers. Use your technical talents to guide our infrastructure needs, so we can continue to solve larger problems and serve even more customers.





What we're made of:

React, grpc-web, GraphQL
Go, gRPC, protobuf, Python
GCP, Kubernetes, Postgres
...and much more

Here's what you'll do:

Build things, lots of things. User interfaces, systems, APIs, libraries, devops tools, automation - there are many large problems to solve. While you may be an expert in a couple areas, you will become proficient in working across all facets of our engineering stack.
Collaborate with teammates through code and design reviews, growing from each other's knowledge and experience.
Work closely with the product and design teams to plan, build and develop new iterations of our product.
Investigate, propose and build new infrastructure and libraries for expanding our capabilities and scalability, as well as improving our reliability and maintainability.
Engage in our devops flow, building and deploying new releases, developing and evaluating our monitoring, investigating bugs and performance issues, and improving our visibility into our system health.
Help build a world-class team through interviewing and knowledge sharing.

We love that you have these qualifications:

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or equivalent with 5+ years experience in commercial software development.
Professional development experience in Go, C++, or Java.
Capable of rapidly producing large amounts of well-documented and tested, thoughtful and maintainable code.
Demonstrated ability to navigate and operate within an open and ambiguous problem space with limited guidance.
Passionate about writing great software, but able to make appropriate tradeoffs to ship quickly.
Thoughtful about designing systems and libraries for ease of use, scalability and extensibility.
Experience shipping both a commercial web product, as well as infrastructure underpinning a commercial product.

It would be nice if:

You have worked in a startup environment before, and both understand and are excited by the breadth of the opportunity and challenges of such an environment.
You have experience working in React, or a comparable JavaScript UI framework.
You have experience working with GCP, AWS or Azure.
You have experience working with containers, e.g., Docker, Kubernetes.
You have experience in at least one scripting language, e.g., Shell, Python, etc.
You have experience working with large data and/or data flow processing systems.
You have a conceptual understanding on how marketing is done on Google and Facebook, and particularly experience with Google Ads.




Have you ever wondered what it would be like to join a fast growing company like Google, Netflix, Amazon, Uber or Twitch when it was a small company? Well, we look forward to meeting you because this may be it!


At Ampd, we are transforming the way that brands and businesses reach their customers. We build simple, intuitive products backed by revolutionary data-driven technology to empower companies to cut through the complexity of digital advertising and focus on building their business. We currently have an unparalleled solution for Amazon sellers wanting to use Google Ads that is quickly gaining traction and momentum, and we want to push to the next level!

description:
Job Title: AWS Principal Architect

Location: Remote

Duration: Fulltime / Permanent

Experience Level: Need candidate with Minimum of 18+ years of IT experience, They should be technically strong.

Mandate Pointers to be focused:

- 70% -- Solutioning / Technical Architecting including Presales Support

- 30% -- Overseeing existing and new opportunities Deliverables

Required Skills & Experience:

Requires BA/BS in Mathematics, Computer Science, Business Administration, or Analytics related field and 18+ years’ related experience in analytics development
Broad experience in data and analytics as well as information architectures specifically
6+ years AWS Cloud Architectures and design patterns
10+ years experience in developing data analytics architectures
8+ years experience in data integration technologies and design patterns
6+ years extensive hands-on experience implementing data migration and data processing using AWS services such as: EC2, S3, LakeFormation, DMS, Kinesis, Kafka, Jenkins, Airflow, Redshift, RDS, Aurora, Neptune, DynamoDB, Cloudtrail, CloudWatch, Docker, Lambda, Spark, Glue, Sage Maker, AI/ML and API GW.
2+ years experience designing and developing visualization tools such as QuickSight or Tableau
Consulting expertise in Cloud Migration Readiness Assessment and Strategy development
Experience working and coding with Python, building CI/CD delivery, Terraform and preferred experience with software using tolls like Cloud 9 IDE and Terraform cloud
Expertise in Application Portfolio / Workload assessments to identify candidates for Cloud Migration
Experience architecting, designing and developing AWS Analytic solutions working with Glue, S3, Redshift, Aurora, Lambda, Athena and QuickSight to build out end to end solutions
Experience with data base technologies such as Oracle, Teradata, SQL Server is preferred to help develop appropriate data migration strategies
Strong data management & EDW fundamentals with generations of information architecting on-premises, on Cloud & hybrid
Experience in developing Analytics Cloud and AWS thought leadership in multiple forms including blogs, white papers and speaking engagements to help promote Trianz’ position on AWS
Experience in advising clients about data on cloud migration approaches and applications
Experience working in an agile development methodologies
Knowledge of Hybrid Cloud Infrastructure including On-Premise, AWS, Azure and GCP
Expertise in articulating Pros and Cons of Cloud Migration
Familiarity with Cloud Services including Security, Monitoring, Networking & Cost Optimization
Familiarity with Cloud Adoption framework, Well Architected Framework and best practices
Intelligent but practical; you want to get things done and love simplicity
Excellent presenter, influencer

Responsibilities

Lead engagements that involve a strategic assessment and / or implementation of our client’s current state infrastructure as they explore the strategic value of moving to the Cloud
Advise on the best Cloud or Hybrid Cloud Architecture that would deliver the business outcomes from an infrastructure, business application and data & analytics perspective
Lead Cloud Readiness Assessments and define the Cloud Migration blueprint and roadmap
Develop the associated road map business case and Total Cost of Ownership for clients
Work with our Digital Applications and Data & Analytics Practices to strategize on Application Portfolio migration to Cloud and priority Data to Cloud based on business drivers and impact
Solution architecture leadership and execution on strategies developed with our clients post the strategy engagement to ensure the team meets the expectations with the clients.
Advise our clients on Cloud Services including Security, Monitoring, Networking & Cost Optimization
Develop best practices and frameworks for Cloud/Hybrid Cloud solutions and driving Cloud Adoption
Collaborate with client stake holders to finalize end-state approach for workloads
Help shape and drive company objectives and independently drive required strategies to completion, using appropriate resources and ensure tasks are completed as required.
Provide technical leadership for one or more accounts to drive growth, working with the engagement manager to assure delivery excellence
Be part of the Analytics Practice leadership to help identify and drive innovation, partnership and growth for Trianz
Work with C-Level and senior client individuals to build strong relationships and proactively address issues in a timely manner as required. Meet with senior client individual as required to provide delivery expertise and drive new business.
Using your experience and passion, provide leadership and guidance with building out innovative solutions, point of views, white papers, blogs and other thought leadership areas that will accelerate our image and implementation and time to market for our clients.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $150,000.00 - $170,000.00 per year

Benefits:

Health insurance

Schedule:

8 hour shift

Experience:

Azure: 6 years (Required)
AWS: 6 years (Required)

Work Location: Remote
qualifications:
Azure: 6 years (Required)

AWS: 6 years (Required)

US work authorization (Required)
