detail:
Job ID: 2210944

Location: REMOTE WORK , MI , US

Date Posted: 2022-07-22

Category: Engineering and Sciences

Subcategory: Systems Engineer

Schedule: Full-time

Shift: Day Job

Travel: Yes, 10 % of the Time

Minimum Clearance Required: None

Clearance Level Must Be Able to Obtain: Secret

Potential for Remote Work: No

Description

SAIC has an opportunity for a Senior Systems Engineer to support work in Warren, MI. SAIC is leading the way in Model Based Systems Engineering (MBSE) and Digital Engineering to enable rapid and futuristic improvements in US Army ground vehicle capabilities. These improvements include development and demonstration of leading edge technologies for new manned and unmanned vehicles including integration and analysis of advanced sensor technologies, vehicle autonomy, and legacy system upgrades. As a Senior Systems Engineer with SAIC, you will be on the leading edge of applying MBSE and Digital Engineering techniques that are reshaping the future.

This is a 100% Remote / Work from Home position.

Performs Systems Engineering activities related to Information Technology or Engineering including: concept of operations formulation, requirements definition, analysis and engineering, system architecting, system analysis and design, interface and data architectures, validation and verification, systems integration, system op. performance analysis, Lifecycle cost analysis estimation, decision analysis and physical configuration analysis (PCA). Ensures the logical and systematic conversion of product requirements into total systems solutions that acknowledge technical, schedule, and cost constraints. Performs functional analysis, timeline analysis, detail trade studies, requirements allocation and interface definition studies to translate customer requirements into hardware and software or engineering specifications. Provides specific, detailed information for selection, implementation techniques, and tools for the most efficient solution to meet business needs, including present and future capacity requirements. From an information technology perspective, may be concerned with floor layout, power cooling, data storage, infrastructure management, backup, monitoring, operating systems, directory services, identity management, access management, and automation. (It should be understood that this is not intended to be a detailed nor comprehensive description of any individual employee's job content. Managers set the specific duties and responsibilities for each employee).

KNOWLEDGE/SKILLS AND ABILITY: Complete understanding and wide application of technical principles, theories, and concepts in the field. General knowledge of other related disciplines. Receives assignments in the form of objectives and establishes goals to meet outlined objectives. Provides direction to employees according to established policies and management guidance. Work is reviewed by management to measure whether objectives have been met.

PROBLEM COMPLEXITY: Provides technical solutions to a wide range of difficult problems where analysis of data requires evaluation of identifiable factors. Solutions are imaginative, thorough, practicable and consistent with organization objectives.

FREEDOM TO ACT: Works under only general direction. Independently determines and develops approach to solutions. Work is reviewed upon completion for adequacy in meeting objectives. Demonstrates good judgment in selecting methods and techniques for obtaining solutions.

IMPACT: Contributes to completion of specific programs and projects. Failure to obtain results or erroneous decisions or recommendations would typically result in serious program delays and considerable expenditure of resources.

LIASON: Frequent inter-organizational and outside customer contacts. Represents organization in providing solutions to difficult technical issues associated with specific projects .

Qualifications

EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE:

Bachelors in Engineering or realted techincal degree and nine (9) years or more experience; Masters and seven (7) years or more experience ; PhD or JD and four (4) years or more experience.
Experience in applying Systems Engineering processes and Model Based System Engineering (MBSE) tools to complex project/product solutions
Experience in DoDAF, SysML and UML modeling, simulation, and analysis
Develop and mature system requirements and interface control documents in DOORS or other requirements management tool
Conduct trade studies and comparative performance assessments of system, subsystem and component alternatives to inform overall system decisions/recommendations
Work with subject matter experts, stakeholders, and customers throughout the process to develop and demonstrate integrated system design in accordance with requirements
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills

CLEARANCE REQUIREMENT:

Must be a US citizen that has or is able to obtain a Secret Level Security Clearance

Target salary range: $125,001 - $135,000. The estimate displayed represents the typical salary range for this position based on experience and other factors.

Covid Policy: SAIC does not require COVID-19 vaccinations or boosters. Customer site vaccination requirements must be followed when work is performed at a customer site.SAIC® is a premier Fortune 500® technology integrator driving our nation's technology transformation. Our robust portfolio of offerings across the defense, space, civilian, and intelligence markets includes secure high-end solutions in engineering, digital, artificial intelligence, and mission solutions. Using our expertise and understanding of existing and emerging technologies, we integrate the best components from our own portfolio and our partner ecosystem to deliver innovative, effective, and efficient solutions that are critical to achieving our customers' missions.

We are more than 26,500 strong; driven by mission, united by purpose, and inspired by opportunities. SAIC is an Equal Opportunity Employer, fostering a respectful work culture based on diversity, equity, and inclusion that values all contributors. Headquartered in Reston, Virginia, SAIC has annual revenues of approximately $7.1 billion. For more information, visit saic.com .


My SAIC Benefits.

CLEARANCE REQUIREMENT:

Must be a US citizen that has or is able to obtain a Secret Level Security Clearance

Target salary range: $125,001 - $135,000. The estimate displayed represents the typical salary range for this position based on experience and other factors.

Covid Policy: SAIC does not require COVID-19 vaccinations or boosters. Customer site vaccination requirements must be followed when work is performed at a customer site.SAIC® is a premier Fortune 500® technology integrator driving our nation's technology transformation. Our robust portfolio of offerings across the defense, space, civilian, and intelligence markets includes secure high-end solutions in engineering, digital, artificial intelligence, and mission solutions. Using our expertise and understanding of existing and emerging technologies, we integrate the best components from our own portfolio and our partner ecosystem to deliver innovative, effective, and efficient solutions that are critical to achieving our customers' missions.

We are more than 26,500 strong; driven by mission, united by purpose, and inspired by opportunities. SAIC is an Equal Opportunity Employer, fostering a respectful work culture based on diversity, equity, and inclusion that values all contributors. Headquartered in Reston, Virginia, SAIC has annual revenues of approximately $7.1 billion. For more information, visit saic.com .

title: SailPoint Principal Architect
detail:
Principal Architect – SailPoint / Access Governance is an advisory services organization delivering execution focused technology expertise that accelerates IT transformation and propels business initiatives forward. 12 Months & 100% Remote Based.

Position Overview:

The Principal Architect is a customer-facing, industry-seasoned, member of the Advisory Services team responsible for developing and delivering successful and thought-leading strategy and architecture engagements to clients. As a trusted advisor to our enterprise clients, the Principal Architect is responsible for understanding unique infrastructure and application requirements and translating business needs into technical solutions and services that deliver positive business outcomes. The Principal Architect is responsible for the entire solution lifecycle from ideation and design through technical configuration and deployment. The Principal Architect will serve as a client advocate delivering thought leadership through technical briefings, technology roadmaps, service and solution workshops, and strategy ideation. Leveraging specialist (and generalist) technology expertise, business knowledge, and professional experience, the Principal Architect will lead complex client engagements, projects, and program initiatives with the support of broader teams. The Principal Architect SailPoint / Access Governance position is primarily focused on SailPoint solutions and technology, identity governance and administration, access governance, and enterprise and information security solution areas with deep experience and expertise with...

Working with and coordinating between Large and complex enterprise IT and Cyber and Information Security environment organizations with proven knowledge and experience cyber and information security and identity management and identity management lifecycle in on-prem and cloud computing environments including Azure and Oracle

Enterprise IT Identity and Access Management (IAM), Identity Governance and Administration (IGA) and Privileged Access Management (PAM) and integration into large and complex enterprise IT environments including Active Directory, Azure Active Directory, Azure Identity, Azure MFA/SSO, AAA implementation and governance

At least 3 years of direct hands-on experience designing, deploying and administering SailPoint product solutions especially in the functional areas of Identity Governance, Access Rights Management, Compliance Control and Automatic User Provisioning (SailPoint Identity Now, SailPoint Security IQ, SailPoint AI)

Deployment of systems and processes in non-regulated and regulated environments – NERC CIP Energy & Utility experience is a plus The Principal Architect is a senior technical professional with diverse industry knowledge, deep technology expertise and know how.

The Principal Architect will have a passion for technology strategy, a strong desire to deliver best-in-class service levels that exceed client expectations, and a proven ability to thrive in a dynamic, fast-paced environment.

Key Responsibilities

Perform the architecture role with authority for your deep areas of technical subject matter expertise – SailPoint, Access Governance, Cyber Security

Lead and deliver strategy and architecture engagements including, high-level technical leadership and service / solution designs, and delivery of near-term and long-range strategy

Understand and assess client business and technology challenges and needs using a professional and structured discovery approach, requirements gathering and a keen problem-solving skillset

Create and develop client solutions that meet business and technology requirements and deliver successful outcomes that delight clients

Develop effective and creative approaches to client challenges and deliver services and solutions for client projects that maximize value, minimize cost, and accelerate time to success

Participate and lightly facilitate project management mechanics and successful project outcomes

Bring a solid “generalist” working knowledge of multiple IT technology domains relevant to large enterprise IT teams to be able to successfully interact with different technology domain team experts, anticipate needs/challenges, build effective solutions with successful outcomes and be a continuous learner of industry trends, technology trends, etc.

Build and maintain strong client relationships as a trusted advisor

Engage clients and partners across a broad spectrum of technical and non-technical roles with tailored, interpersonal and business communication skills...

Verbal – lead and conduct client and partner meetings, interviews, workshops, etc.

Written – creating technical proposals, strategic project documentation and related deliverables, technology/solution whitepapers, etc.

Presentations – creating and delivering client presentations, video on demand and webinar material, speaking engagements, etc.

Diagrams – developing conceptual, architectural, and procedural diagrams

Create and deliver as-built and operational documentation and training content for handoff to client engineering and operations teams

Foster key partnerships with manufacturers, service providers, and partners

Maintain relevant industry and technology solution knowledge, skills, and experience

Support business development and participate in marketing events as required

Qualifications

10+ years of experience in senior information technology leadership (strategy, architecture and engineering roles preferred) relating to SailPoint, Access Governance, and Cyber Security

Technology consulting experience roles in SailPoint, Access Governance, and Cyber Security preferred

Strong preference given to having the blended experience of roles across enterprise IT client organizations, technology manufacturers, and technology solution providers

Strong preference given to active, relevant industry and/or manufacturer architect-level certifications

Bachelors degree in computer science, engineering, mathematics or related experienced strongly preferred

Advanced technical degree in computer science, engineering or MBA considered

Excellent interpersonal, verbal and written skills, good listener, ability to connect with different personalities - demonstrated business acumen and executive presence

Ability to solve complex, abstract problems with creative solutions and practical approach

Excellent collaboration and team-oriented skills including working with distributed, virtual teams

Hands on experience with design/implementation/administration of IAM/IGA/PAM solutions – SailPoint Products strongly preferred

Organized and methodical with strong prioritization and multi-tasking skills

description:
Dearborn
Ford Motor Credit Company
Ford Motor Credit Company

Job Description & Qualifications

The people of Ford Motor Credit Company have a 60-year commitment to helping put people behind the wheels of great Ford and Lincoln vehicles. By partnering with dealerships, we provide financing, personalized service, and professional expertise to five thousand dealers and more than four million customers in over 100 countries around the world!

If you’re customer-focused, driven and seeking the opportunity to experience exciting challenges and growth, look no further!

What you’ll be able to do:
Lead architecture direction to create new software and product capabilities while maintaining the current platforms; should be achieved through the development of a technology roadmap that is capable of scale and customizable to customer requirements.
Partner with the global product organization and business operations to develop architecture and technology strategies and solutions.
Lead initiatives to ensure a strong team architecture culture across all engineering teams.
Set architecture and design direction (technologies, patterns, design principles, development frameworks) by leading global solution architects.
Formulate and communicate Ford Credit architecture direction in areas of uncertainty.
Encourage a continuous improvement mentality passionate about reducing technical debt and security vulnerabilities.
Lead a focused team of 11 direct reports across multiple geographies to deliver the desired results and outcomes. Additionally, it is critical for the Principal Architect to work in direct partnership with other global technology teams to ensure architecture is aligned to the broader organization and security requirements.
Remain current on the most sophisticated technologies that will impact Ford’s business.
Ensure the highest architecture and security standards for Ford Credit.
Provide hands-on leadership, maintain visibility and accessibility to critical partners and foster a culture of business enablement.
Partner with third-party suppliers to ensure consistent and balanced security, architecture, and engineering standards.
Develop complementary team leadership by actively engaging in career planning for architects.
Drive information integration, information standards, and information management through domain-driven design, data mesh concepts, and value analysis and assessment.
Understand the impact of national and international laws and regulations regarding financial services and products (both existing and expected) and ensure the architecture strategy properly coordinates with all relevant regulations.
Drive learning and knowledge sharing relating to architecture standard methodologies throughout the Ford Credit community.
Interpret and use Ford Credit business strategies to anticipate future technology needs architecture must support.
The minimum requirements we seek:
Bachelors degree in Computer Science, Business Administration, or related field or a combination of education and equivalent experience
5+ years of experience leading architecture teams, with a background in growing teams delivering enterprise architecture based in cloud-native technologies and omni-channel software solutions
3+ years of experience leading a globally distributed, multi-functional architecture organization
5+ years of experience working with critical business collaborators and clients to effectively communicate, plan, and deliver a new digital engineering and software platform
5+ years of experience sitting with product and business partners to translate business concepts to technology and product strategy
5+ years of experience as a key technical decision-maker and influencer for distributed systems and microservices architectures
5+ years of experience with outstanding organizational talent, the ability to develop long term strategies, set priorities, and work under pressure
3+ years of experience with iterative development methodologies, including the product-driven organization model.
3+ years of experience operating at a senior level, on multiple or large-scale projects, incorporating all aspects of IT development
5+ years of experience leading architecture for product development teams, balancing business viability, technical feasibility, and customer desirability
5+ years of experience building strong teams and relationships with business partners, (internal and external) demonstrating professionalism in all actions
5+ years of experience communicating effectively with all levels of management in varying areas of business and IT
5+ years of experience with an eye for business & systems thinking skills
3+ years of experience reviewing process performance with senior leaders and obtain the support required to overcome deployment and improvement challenges
5+ years of experience “delivering results” and completing projects on time with quality
3+ years of deeply technical experience and presently with a successful product, consumer-facing or financial services company
5+ years of experience managing existing software products as well as the migration to a cloud-native platform
3+ years of experience architecting multiple successful enterprise SaaS/Cloud product lines or software products
3+ years of experience working with cyber security and secure architecture standards
5+ years of experience working with cloud native technologies, including software craftmanship, rapid prototyping, and agile development practices
3+ years of experience leading both internal and external resources with technical depth in emerging areas, e.g., FinTech, analytics, application development and strong security practices
Our preferred qualifications:
Experience building software and services for financial institutions
What you’ll receive in return:

As part of the Ford family, you’ll enjoy excellent compensation and a comprehensive benefits package that includes generous PTO, retirement, savings and stock investment plans, incentive compensation and much more. You’ll also experience exciting opportunities for professional and personal growth and recognition.

Candidates for positions with Ford Motor Company must be legally authorized to work in the United States on a permanent basis. Verification of employment eligibility will be required at the time of hire. Visa sponsorship is not available for this position.

We are an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to a culturally diverse workforce. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, age, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability status or protected veteran status.

For information on Ford's salary and benefits, please visit:

https://corporate.ford.com/content/dam/corporate/us/en-us/documents/careers/2022-benefits-and-comp-LL5-sal-plan-1.pdf

At Ford, the health and safety of our employees is our top priority. Vaccination has been proven to play a critical role in combating COVID-19. As a result, Ford has made the decision to require U.S. salaried employees to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19, unless employees require an accommodation for religious or medical reasons. Being fully vaccinated means that an individual is at least two weeks past their final dose of an authorized COVID-19 vaccine regimen. As a condition of employment, newly hired employees will be required to provide proof of their COVID-19 vaccination or an approved medical or religious exemption.

Principal Engineer / Java
detail:
My client is a commercial real estate and investment firm based out of SF that is launching new services that combines over 100 years of industry knowledge and cutting edge technology like NLP and Big Data. This company provides a stable work environment with no shortage of resources. Because this is a special team, candidates would be working on a small team and function almost as a separate entity.

This client is looking for a Senior Principal Software Engineer to work with Java and Golang on several ML projects to actionable insights to their clients. This is an opportunity to work on modern technology like microservices and distributed systems.
Required Skills & Experience
8+ Years of Professional Experience with Java, Python, or Golang
Familiarity of ML
Exposure to one of the following: Kafka, Redis or Elasticsearch
3+ Years of relevant noSQL database experience

Microservices

Daily Responsibilities

100% Hands On

Healthcare

detail:
A well known streaming company in the South Bay area is looking to add senior and principal engineers onto their team. This company has been growing consistently in the entertainment space and as they bring on more customers and users, they need to continue to grow the team to continue to bring the best product and services to the market and to their suers.

As a Software Engineer, you will be working across multiple divisions to setup and complete greenfield projects for their most important groups will be able to scale and grow. You will also be working on real time processing and data messaging with the high traffic they receive. Required Skills & Experience

Full Stack Engineer - Rails and React
detail:
This company serves Fortune 500 and fast-growing data-driven organizations across a wide variety of industries, including autonomous vehicles, intelligent personal assistants, medical image labeling, consumer product identification, content categorization, customer support ticket classification, social data insight, CRM data enrichment, product categorization, and search relevance. They are looking for a Senior Full Stack Engineer that will be working primarily in Ruby on Rails and React. This would be a full time, remote role!

Their users range from engineers and data scientists to subject matter experts creating training data for machine learning. The engineer will be working on the most important problems in technology today: how can humans and AI collaborate to solve important and sometimes complicated tasks?

Required Skills & Experience

4+ years of experience developing commercial web applications.
2+ years of experience with Ruby / Ruby on Rails
2+ years of experience with React/Redux.
2+ years of experience with working with Node.js platform and tools.
Excellent knowledge of JavaScript and CSS.
Proficiency with command line and Chrome Developer Tools.
Experience with Git, Docker, Jira, Confluence.

What You Will Be Doing

Tech Breakdown

70% Backend
30% Frontend

The Offer

You will receive the following benefits:

Medical & Dental Insurance
401(k)
Paid Sick Time Leave

Principal Engineer / Medical Devices / REMOTE
detail:
Job Description
Are you a developer looking to bring your skills to a socially responsible company? This start-up, founded by an emergency room doctor and a technology entrepreneur, is transforming the healthcare industry by creating medical devices that supply data trends and predictions for Medicare patients.

This company is looking to hire a Senior Staff Software Engineer that will get to design and develop their nurse application which helps track trends and predictions based on patient data. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in Java, Spring Boot, Microservices, and CICD as you will be deploying your own code. This is a full-time, fully remote role offering a competitive salary and equity and is a great opportunity to make an impact in the healthcare world. Apply today to be considered!
Required Skills & Experience
Strong Java experience
Strong experience with Spring or Spring Boot
Experience with Microservices
Experience with CICD
Excellent communication
Desired Skills & Experience
Experience with AWS or other cloud platform
Prior leadership experience
BS or MS in Computer Science

100% Development

Principal Full Stack Engineer
detail:
Piper Companies is actively seeking a Principal Full Stack Engineer to join a financial service corporation in Durham, North Carolina . The Principal Full Stack Engineer will be responsible for joining a fast-paced, supportive team to assist with structuring channels that support the digital presence of the company.

Responsibilities of the Principal Full Stack Engineer:

Responsible for deploying features of the omni channel platforms.
Responsible for proposing ideas that will upgrade current products.
Motivation to learn new skills as well as use current skills to benefit company.
Responsible for working well in a highly collaborative environment.

Qualifications of the Principal Full Stack Engineer:

Proficient in Angular and Node.js.
Experience in Java preferred but not required.
Ability to work well in team environments.
Experience with React and Vue.

Compensation for the Principal Full Stack Engineer:

Salary: $ 135,000
Full benefits: Medical, Dental, Vision, 401k Match, PTO

This role can sit in Durham NC, Boston MA, Richmond VA, Washington DC, Houston TX, Charlotte NC, Austin TX, Merrimack NH, Smithfield RI

description:
Senior Front End Developer (Typescript + React.js)
100% Remote
Long Term Contract

About the Role:

Signify is working with a global FinTech company on a mission to help their members with improving their credit scores and managing their finances. No, this isn't a debt company, credit card company or banking institution - the goal is financial freedom!

Building on our success in 2021, we are now working on an exclusive requirement for a skilled Front End Developer (TypeScript + React.js) to work on a fin-tech platform which is already one of the most used globally and contribute to their continued feature expansion.

What you’ll do

Immediate impact on critical efforts including building new product features.
Opportunity to influence and shape the direction of the product with your own take.
Build integrations with other internal services and deliver product features for customers at scale.

Requirements

Strong Experience with TypeScript and React.js

Committed 2 step interview process with an established client who we have made multiple recent placements with - all with strong candidate feedback.

Must be eligible to accept employment in the USA without requiring sponsorship now or in the future. We are not working with any third party vendors (C2C).

Job Types: Full-time, Contract

Salary: $90.00 - $120.00 per hour

Benefits:

Dental insurance
Flexible schedule
Health insurance
Vision insurance

Schedule:

Monday to Friday

Experience:

TypeScript: 3 years (Required)

Work Location: Remote

Hi ,

We have a job opening for the position of MultiCloud Principal Architect.

Cloud Principal Architect

Experience: 12+ years
Work with Central Architecture team to provide direction, architecture overview and road map of services
Experience creating reference architectures, seed patterns for hybrid multi-cloud
Experience with Hybrid multi-Cloud Strategy
Deep experience with AWS, Azure, Google Cloud Platform,
Experience setting up multi-cloud security plane
Experience with multi-cloud CI/CD planes
3+ years in architecting, designing, and delivering highly scalable services on AWS, Azure, Google Cloud Platform
Active Contributions to any CNCF projects a plus
Experience with container technology (Kubernetes), Infrastructure Automation (Terraform, Chef, Puppet, Ansible), operational monitoring & debugging

Relevant certifications
Thought leadership, Channel presence
Presented in Cloud Partner events

Featured blogs

Muthu.k,

Senior Associate.

SecureKloud Technologies

3+ years in architecting, designing, and delivering highly scalable services on AWS, Azure, Google Cloud Platform
Active Contributions to any CNCF projects a plus

Proven deep technical expertise in hybrid multi-cloud
Well versed in multiple large-scale implementations
Relevant certifications
Thought leadership, Channel presence
Presented in Cloud Partner events
Published white papers, Articles, frameworks in partner forums
Featured blogs

Regards,

Muthu.k,

title: Principal Controls Engineer
Principal FPGA Design Engineer
detail:
RESPONSIBILITIES:
A Kforce client is seeking to hire a Principal FPGA Design Engineer in Chandler, Arizona (AZ).

Summary:
Our client a growing global aerospace company that acquired a small company a few years ago is seeking a Senior or Principal FPGA Design Engineer preferably with Lead experience. We are working directly with the Hiring Manager on this exclusive search assignment. The company offers a competitive compensation package including base salary, profit sharing, 401K matching, etc.

Responsibilities include:
* Principal FPGA Design Engineer will lead a group of highly talented engineers to design, manufacture, and test electrical spacecraft hardware
* Provide hands-on design to turn customer requirements into electronics that will operate in a space environment
* Direct Innovative space-bound designs that include electronics used in Rovers, the Space Station, and satellites positioned in various orbits
* Principal FPGA Design Engineer has system and test integration

REQUIREMENTS:
* Bachelor's degree in Electrical Engineering or similar field
* 10-15+ years of experience in electrical hardware design
* Strong FPGA Design experience
* Ideal candidate would have knowledge of digital, analog and FPGA designs
* Self-driven, team-oriented individual who is hardworking, energetic, and works well with customers
* Technically astute individual with a strong foundation in electrical engineering design
* MSEE is a plus
* Systems engineering is a plus
* Experience in the Aerospace or Aviation industries is preferred

Kforce is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status.

description:

https://www.onstrider.com/job-seekers

About Strider
Strider is a talent marketplace for remote tech professionals. Companies from the USA and Canada use Strider as a hiring platform to find vetted talent in American time-zones. Job seekers sign-up for Strider to be seen by top North American companies who are looking for full-time professionals to join their team and grow with them. Strider candidates are paired with dedicated Talent Agents to build their profile in the most optimal way and receive interview training and career guidance. Our team's goal is to understand your strengths, interests, and preferences, and help you prepare to do well in the positions you choose to consider.

Opportunities at Strider
We have many interesting opportunities across many different tech stacks, mostly in American and Canadian start-ups.

Remote
US$40k-120k / year
Mid-Senior
Full-stack
Node + React / React + Ruby on Rails

We only work with the best companies, so you can feel confident that any company you meet on our platform is well-funded, has a strong team, interesting challenges, and pays international wages.

Requirements
Requirements differ from company to company, so we only include the most essential requirements below.

Able to communicate well in English both spoken and written
At least 3 years of experience building web applications in production environments
Experience working as a web software developer
Mastery of one or more programming languages and mobile frameworks
Ability to deliver well-coded, functioning software that meets project requirements

Apply to sign-up

We'll review your profile and, if selected, we'll schedule an intro call to share details on our process and understand what type of opportunities you're looking for.

title: Full Stack Engineer
Full Stack Engineer / JavaScript / Java
detail:
The financial watchdog of the United States is looking for a Full Stack Engineer to join their financial regulation team in Sherman Oaks.

In this role you will be integrating with a senior team that has a penchant for identifying fraudulent financial transactions, insider trading, and has unmasked financial criminals including a pastor who had gone undetected for 40 years! Your main responsibility will be coming up with a solution: taking massive amounts of real-time financial data and creating an elegant UI that is intuitive and usable so analysts can identify financial transaction anomalies, and identify criminal conspirators. Other responsibilities include helping port their applications from their onsite servers to the cloud--no prior cloud experience required.

Technologies they use include Angular 2+, Java 8, Postgres, NoSQL, ELK, Big Data Tools, and Cloud Technologies, however, no prior experience with these technologies is required. Non-negotiables include strong UI experience, experience building commercial products, working with modern JavaScript libraries and frameworks (Angular 1, React.js, or Vue.js), and team-oriented personality.

If you're looking for a mission driven organization that is not only stable but is building data intensive, commercial grade applications, this is great place to work.
Required Skills & Experience
Experience with HTML, CSS, JavaScript
Experience with AngularJS, React.js, or Vue.js
Eye for design, not necessarily a designer
Strong advocate for the user and usability
Experience with Java
Desired Skills & Experience
BS in Computer Science or related field
Experience with Angular 2+
Experience with TypeScript
What You Will Be Doing
Tech Breakdown

60% Front End Development
20% Back End Development
20% Application Architecture and Design

Daily Responsibilities

80% Hands on Development
20% Team collaboration
The Offer
You will receive the following benefits:

Medical Insurance & Health Savings Account (HSA)
Paid Sick Time Leave
Pre-tax Commuter Benefit
Flexible Hours

Applicants must be currently authorized to work in the United States on a full-time basis now and in the future.

description:
RCM is hiring for a Large Company that is looking for Full time Remote talent. The company is a cloud-based video conferencing platform that can be used for video conferencing meetings, audio conferencing, webinars, meeting recordings, and live chat.

This is a senior level position.


Responsibilities:

Monitor and manage service quality - Knowledge on monitoring and management tools Telecom experience and extensive knowledge of Service provider and voice technologies, IP Telephony and Conferencing solutions.

Take end-to-end ownership of customer issues, including initial troubleshooting, identification of root cause and issue resolution.

Collect information and document bugs with Engineering for product issues that are impacting customers. Build process or troubleshooting documentation in the support knowledge base. Deliver against customer experience and efficiency targets.

Collaborate with multiple tiers of support, act as an escalation point, and investigate complex/corner issues including WEB/Client/Server/Database service, debugging complex different OS environments and platforms.

Assess and prioritize customer cases to ensure timely response and resolution according to service standards and best practices, with an emphasis on escalated cases.

Meet or exceed customer expectations on response quality, timeliness of responses and overall customer experience. Serve as internal and external point of contact on customer matters and ensure customer issues are resolved as expediently as possible.


Requirements:


5+ years of relevant industry experience

BS Degree (or equivalent experience) in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or in a related field.

Knowledge & Experience in web related such as spring framework, Tomcat, Ngnix

Working knowledge of programming technologies and languages, SQL queries to troubleshoot applications.

Experience with Linux, networking also in cloud environment (AWS, Azure)

High attention to detail and ability to troubleshoot with limited information and a clear plan of action.

Experience with JIRA, or other bug tracking tools.

Excellent written and verbal communication skills.

Previous Support Engineering / Developer Support experience also a big plus!

Experience in programming languages of Java/Python

description:
Principal Software Engineer - Data Junkie

Company Overview
CCG is a technology company focused on equipping customers with the capabilities and support to conduct intelligent and successful cyber operations. We do this by finding the most talented engineers and operators in the country, give them some of the most challenging problems facing the US government, and help them unleash their creativity and problem-solving skills. Excellence is our standard and mission success is our metric.

Role
This position is part of a high functioning, high performing team and will combine expertise in multiple technical areas including software development, networking, DevOps, and UI development. The role provides an opportunity to shape service component interactions and architect data models for flexible and efficient data retrieval and analytics. As a senior technical staff member, you will be expected to mentor and guide the other members of the team in a relentless pursuit of excellence.

The person that fills this role will have the opportunity to influence the technical direction and growth of this unique team. If you thrive in a fast paced, flexible, and autonomous working environment, then come stand out by blending in with Chameleon Consulting Group.
This is a remote position.
Required Qualifications
Ability to obtain a security clearance (note, only US Citizens are eligible for security clearances)
Extensive experience building and maintaining APIs for end-users and integrators
Highly proficient in Python
Highly proficient in containerization using Docker
Experience coordinating the deployment of containers using docker-compose and Kubernetes
Working knowledge of relational and graph databases (PostgreSQL, ArangoDB)
Ability to collaborate as a team but execute independently
Comfortable in a high trust, adaptable, team environment
Preferred Qualifications
Current TS/SCI security clearance
Experience with Linux System Programming in C
Working knowledge of message queue and task queue technologies (Kafka, ZeroMQ)
Prior experience with web UI development (React), and Graphical User Interface conceptualization and development
We are an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or veteran status.

description:
Job Summary:

The Software Engineer will create and manage all aspects of detailed software systems based upon documented requirements. He or she will review bugs and test software to ensure compliance to requirements while thoroughly documenting all results. They will add their unique input to multiple integrated software components and will provide guidance and insight regarding hardware/software trade-offs. The successful candidate will be able to discuss the pros and cons of software reuse versus new development and will carry out requirements analysis and synthesis for individual components while considering the holistic integration of components as the system requires.

This role will be remotely supporting commercial and IR&D projects for approximately 2 first months of employment, and then will be expected to rotate back into access.

Qualifications:

Available positions range from associate to senior level.
Positions range from front end, middle tier, back end, or full stack development focus
Proficient or Mastery in some or all the following development technologies
Java, Linux, NOSQL and relational data stores
Javascript (various frameworks)
RESTFUL Services
Hadoop
Accumulo
ELK Stack
AWS
TS/SCI with polygraph required.

:

Responsibilities:

Generate process-intensive analytics and algorithms.
Big data processing and manipulation of large data sets.
Ensure functioning of real-time systems and business management information systems.
Developing, enhancing and maintaining software applications through collaboration in teams ranging from 2 to 20 persons to ensure product requirements are met.
Implement and abide by standard development & documentation practices for unit test development, and peer code review activities.
Designing, developing, testing, debugging, and refining software.
Integrate existing software into new or modified systems or operating environments.

title: Remote Software Engineer
Full stack Engineer
detail:
Role: Full stack Engineer

Location- Durham, NC or Boston, MA (Remote)

Duration: Long-Term Contract

This role with our direct client,

Job Description:

The Role

The Full Stack Engineer is responsible for working closely with the Technical Lead to architect, design and build pilots and new products. Candidates must be comfortable working with a small team of developers in a fast paced and highly ambiguous environment working with emerging technologies, high risks and uncertain

Are you energized by rapid software development? Do you want to combine the fast pace of a start up with the financial backing of one of the most successful companies in the industry? Then be part of an exciting new incubator within Fidelity geared at rapidly move ideas from concepts to scale to help bring these game-changing ideas to market. If you are a highly skilled Software Engineer with a passion for creating products and services that make lives better, a career in FCAT (Fidelity Center for Applied Technology) may be right for you!

The Expertise and Skills You Bring

Bachelor level degree in Computer Science, Engineering or another technical field

Experience in a diverse set of distributed application development and middleware technologies Rest/SOAP, Web Services, XML, JAVA, J2EE, SQL, HTML, Java Script, and Spring
Web services Development JSON, XML, REST, SOAP, etc.
Building and Deploying applications using continuous integration pipelines and automated deployment tools such as Jenkins.
Good understanding of object oriented and functional programming and design and software engineering practices for the full software development life cycle, including coding standards, code reviews, source control management, build processes, testing and operations
Experience in delivering software in the Agile environment.
Amazon Web Services (AWS) experience preferred
Collaborate with technology and business teams to deliver high-quality solutions for business problems

Strong technical skills and a passion for programming

Thanks & Regards,

Shivam Awasthi

Senior Executive- Recruitment (US Operations)

VBeyond Corporation

Noida I Lucknow | Chennai |New Jersey, USA

LinkedIn:- https://www.linkedin.com/in/shivam-awasthi-3a2183186/

subTitle:

Remote
Remote
description:
About the Principal Software Engineer position

We're looking for a full–time Principal Software Engineer to produce and implement effective backend software solutions and work closely with our CPO to define software requirements and lead the development team to fulfill those requirements. In addition to developing key systems, the person in this role will be responsible for managing the development team.

Apart from the development of information systems, the principal engineer will also be responsible for team management, monitoring, reporting, and proper and timely project execution. The principal Engineer will lead a team of developers who will be responsible for building new websites as well as supporting existing websites.

About the Ideal Candidate

A successful candidate should have experience both in hands-on software engineering and leading an engineering team. This experience includes making software architecture designs (UML), project planning, and aligning engineers.

Our system will contain many microservices, as well as an Unreal Engine application/game, and our codebase is hosted and managed in GitHub and Perforce. We will be working closely together with many non-technical artists. Ideally, you will have worked in a role where you've shipped studio-quality unreal engine apps.

Principle Engineer responsibilities are:
Work closely with senior stakeholders to understand business requirements and help translate these into technical requirements & timelines for the development team
Plan and document technical specifications for features or system design
Design, build and configure applications to meet business process and application requirements
Lead the engineering team's general work and design decisions
Direct the development team to create algorithms and data structures
Write testable, scalable, and efficient code
Mentor & train junior team members and ensure the team follows engineering best practices
Drive the hiring process for new engineers (help build & grow their team)

Principle Engineer skill requirements are:
8+ years of experience with general software development, including backend development, microservices, and software architecture (UML, system design, etc)
Source control experience with Git and Perforce
Several years of proven success as a technical team leader
Excellent communication skills & the ability to translate between technical and non-technical worlds
Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science or Mathematics

Job Description

Ideally, we are seeking Full Stack SW Engineers that are competent with C#/.Net programming, along with knowledge of frontend technologies such as Angular, React and JavaScript, and backend systems similar to Oracle, SQL, MySQL or PostGres.
This is an exciting new venture and a unique opportunity to contribute to and be a part of building a completely new business that is incubated within a large, stable, mature company. This is a hands-on position and we are seeking candidates who are passionate about coding and SW development.
The following states are acceptable for hire as a remote employee with travel to our clients office 1 week per quarter, with all expenses paid, for management meetings: Arkansas, Florida, Illinois, North Carolina, New Jersey, Nevada, New York, Maine, Ohio and New Hampshire. Must Have Skills
Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or related field is ideal, but not required. Open to candidates at the Jr, Mid, or Senior levels
Solid understanding of objected-oriented design and software engineering principles. Along with data structures and understanding of complex algorithms. Seeking strong Computer Science professionals!
Seeking knowledge in as many Full Stack SW Engineering languages as possible, including: FRONTEND JavaScript, react, Angular // MID-TIER: C#, .Net, Java, NodeJS, prefer someone from C# or .Net but open // BACKEND: is Oracle but open to SQL or MYSQL or PostGres
Experience supporting a Business to Consumer (B2C) platform is highly desirable
Strong Agile/Scrum framework understanding is required
Good working knowledge of coding and architectural design patterns (MVC, MVVM) is a big plus
Seeking candidates that are passionate about SW Development and coding

detail:
Hybrid work Schedule- Onsite 2-3 days per week




Overview




We are looking for a passionate and self-motivated Senior Engineer to join our PACE team. PACE (P&L and Accounting Engines) is a 400+ person global, diverse and award-winning team, who partners with our business in investment banking and treasury finance to create propositions and solutions to delight our users through-out the value chain, starting in T+1 Product Control and providing the necessary information to the General Ledger from Transaction and Hedge Accounting. At PACE we believe in and create opportunities to do things differently. With our products, we focus to continually improve efficiency of our business systems and processes.







What We Offer You:








We offer competitive health and wellness benefits, empowering you to value life in and out of the office








An environment that encourages networking and collaboration across functions and businesses








Conveniently located nature trails, accessible year-round











Your Key Responsibilities:








Analyze and evaluate the business requirements (collect, interpret and map the requirements of the customer to the capabilities of the product)








Work with our clients to deliver value through the delivery of high-quality software within an agile development lifecycle








Bring deep industry knowledge into the Feature Team to understand problems, leverage design patterns, automation to support a CI and CD pipeline to production and support emergent design within the agreed domain target architecture








Contribute to the wider domain objectives to ensure flow, consistent standards and approach to software development and design to a common shared framework








Deep business & technical analysis with ability to provide technical and functional support








Facilitate configuration management in Markets Finance strategic products











Your Skills and Experience:








Extensive experience in IT industry with hands-on development in Programming in one or more of the following languages / frameworks- Java, NodeJS, Kotlin, ReactJS, Angular and/or Oracle tools








Experience with Service Orientated Architecture or Microservices








Build platform enabler architectural use cases








Experience with Test Driven Development (TDD) and Behavior Driven Development (BDD) including testing frameworks (Junit, Cucumber and/or Selenium








Expertise in Bit Bucket, JIRA and ability of using Confluence












Digital Intelligence Systems, LLC (DISYS) is an Equal Opportunity Employer that recruits and hires qualified candidates without regard to race, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, disability, or veteran status.

title: Full Stack Engineer
Principal Architect
detail:
RESPONSIBILITIES:
Kforce has a client in South Miami, FL that is seeking a Principal Architect for a remote position. The primary purpose of this role is to lead the development and communication of target-state architectures, roadmaps, and solutions for technologies at the product portfolio level.

Responsibilities:
* With time and experience, the Principal Architect may support several technologies spanning multiple product portfolios and/or multiple complex architecture domains (e.g., business, application, data, infrastructure); This includes building high-quality architecture solutions as well as providing expertise and guidance on the design and establishment of architecture standards that align with current and future business needs
* Develops and maintains the architecture for assigned area and drives the adoption of new technologies
* The Principal Architect works with little or no oversight and provides coaching and direction to more junior level architects on the team

REQUIREMENTS:
* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field
* 12+ years of experience in technology disciplines
* Experience with architecting highly scalable & highly available systems, experience with mobile & other emerging technology trends
* Ability to synthesize conclusions from research, compare various solutions & plot complex technology roadmaps
* Broad experience across business, application, information, infrastructure & security architecture domains
* Deep solution architecture experience as well as an understanding of technical trends and innovation
* Strategic thought process, strong business acumen, and the ability to influence senior leadership
* Broad experience across business analysis, product design, engineering, QA, operations & sustainment in a large corporation/enterprise environment
* Technical experience in consumer/employee facing enterprise systems
* Expertise in technical architecture, application systems design & integration in a large heterogeneous enterprise environ. with hands on experience in MicroServices, Java/J2EE, XML, Websphere/Weblogic/Apache TomCat Application Server, Rules Engine, Oracle or DB2 programming methodologies
* Expert understanding of the code/coding practices
* Demonstrable analytical & problem solving skills
* Deep understanding/experience of AWS, Azure cloud computing environments & services
* Excellent communication & relationship skills, especially the ability to articulate advanced technical topics to both technical/non-technical staff
* Strong presentation skills

Kforce is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status.

MedQIA is looking for an experienced well qualified full stack Sr. Software Engineer with 10+ years experience. Strong AI, developer, Microservices Architecture, Algorithm and Python experience to join our awesome team of engineers. This role is remote, however the person must reside within the USA.

JOB TITLE
Senior Software Engineer

PERSONNEL TYPE
Employee

DEPARTMENT

Computer Vision & Engineering

DESCRIPTION

Responsible for leading the development of company products for Clinical Trial Management and Radiology Decision Support services..

REPORTS TO
Director of Engineering/Product

RESPONSIBILITIES & ACCOUNTABILITIES

Leads design, architecting, prototyping and implementation of modules and software solutions with a deep focus on performance, scalability, and maintainability.
Manages the development of software and associated documentation following company product development processes.
Provides guidance on validation activities to verify that software meets requirement specifications.
Provides technical guidance to software development vendors and contractors.
Develops and maintains standard operating procedure on product development processes.
Develops, supports, and maintains company’s products and associated infrastructure.
Provides technical client support as needed.

EDUCATION & EXPERIENCE

BS/MS in Computer Science, Computer Engineering preferred, or equivalent experience
7+ years of industry experience in designing complex large-scale distributed systems on the cloud.
Experience designing and developing Microservices using one of following languages Java, Python, Node.
Experience with JavaScript frameworks, RESTful API, and web technologies.
Solid understanding of application deployment environments: web server tuning, server load balancing, caching techniques, MySQL, Postgres, Messaging Queues, MongoDB and Redis
Working knowledge of Agile software development processes
Experience mentoring and training software engineers

RESPONSIBILITIES & ACCOUNTABILITIES

Leads design, architecting, prototyping and implementation of modules and software solutions with a deep focus on performance, scalability, and maintainability.
Manages the development of software and associated documentation following company product development processes.
Provides guidance on validation activities to verify that software meets requirement specifications.
Provides technical guidance to software development vendors and contractors.
Develops and maintains standard operating procedure on product development processes.
Develops, supports, and maintains company’s products and associated infrastructure.
Provides technical client support as needed.

EDUCATION & EXPERIENCE

BS/MS in Computer Science, Computer Engineering preferred, or equivalent experience
7+ years of industry experience in designing complex large-scale distributed systems on the cloud.
Experience designing and developing Microservices using one of following languages Java, Python, Node.
Experience with JavaScript frameworks, RESTful API, and web technologies.
Solid understanding of application deployment environments: web server tuning, server load balancing, caching techniques, MySQL, Postgres, Messaging Queues, MongoDB and Redis
Working knowledge of Agile software development processes
Experience mentoring and training software engineers

description:
Close Date: 8/15/2022
Overview

We are seeking an outstanding senior or principal level software engineer to help modernize our software platform, transition our systems to the cloud, and foster software engineering excellence at Conservice. You will work in an Agile environment to deliver excellent software running in an Azure cloud environment. You will be a leader, working alongside other developers and teams to mentor, inspire, and drive execution. You will be involved in training and guiding developers to implement solutions that utilize standard software engineering and architecture techniques to keep our software systems easy to understand, easy to develop, easy to maintain, and easy to deploy.

Responsibilities
You will develop working software that demonstrates a commitment to quality and an understanding of software engineering principles. Your software will serve as an example of how to write code for junior developers.
You will help lead other developers in adopting good software engineering and architectural practices to create software that is easy to understand, develop, maintain, and deploy.
You will be key in helping discover and implement innovative solutions to complex technical problems.
Keep abreast of industry trends, and offer solutions based on your discovery of emerging technologies, tools, and practices.
Help make decisions about technology, software, and tools, taking features, cost and ease of use into consideration.
Work with other developers to help mentor and empower them to come up with innovative effective solutions using good software engineering practices.
Demonstrate excellent communication skills in working with other engineers and clearly explaining technical issues and solutions to stakeholders and other non-technical colleagues.
You will regularly deliver functional software solutions that create value for the company within reasonable but ambitious deadlines.

Pay:Salary DOE

Requirements:
Technical Qualifications

Demonstrate knowledge of and prior experience with:

Modern software engineering and architecture concepts, patterns, and practices
Troubleshooting, debugging, and fixing existing software
Algorithm design
Creating new software
A software development IDE, preferably Microsoft Visual Studio or Visual Studio Code
Logging, monitoring, and visibility concepts and tools
Proficiency in a high level programming language, data query languages, and data languages. Experience in the following is a plus, however fundamental software engineering principles are more important than specific language experience:
C#
JavaScript
TypeScript
React
HTML, CSS
SQL (SQL Server and PostgreSQL)
JSON
XML
Git source code control tools and associated development practices
Development of software using Docker or other application containerization technologies
Development using continuous integration and deployment systems
Balancing business requirements with technical considerations

detail:
Principal Analytics Engineer for fast growing pharma consulting firm / 100% remote / Up to 200k base

This Jobot Job is hosted by: Christine McNamara
Are you a fit? Easy Apply now by clicking the "Apply Now" button and sending us your resume.
Salary: $160,000 - $200,000 per year

A bit about us:

A fast growing healthcare consulting firm is looking to bring on a Senior BI Engineer to join their team. The role will include strategic oversight for data visualization development efforts, maintain a high level of fluency in data delivery tools and techniques to ensure that the best visualization solutions are being leveraged for information delivery, as well as translate from functional requirements to technical specifications as it relates to data visualization. This is a high impact role where you will also be involved in managing a portfolio of use case-based dashboards for their high profile Life Sciences clients.

100% remote.

Why join us?

100% remote work
Equity
Flexible work schedule
Medical, dental, vision coverage
Annual performance bonus
401k with company match
Generous PTO and sick leave
Collaborative team culture


Job Details

Skills & Experience:

Technical skills in 2 of the following are required:

o Python, Tableau, Power BI, DataIku, Snowflake, and Alteryx

Prior experience with at least Life Science datasets:

o Pharmacy claims data (prescription data)
o Medical claims data/anonymized patient level data (APLD)
o EDI transaction data (867, 852, 837, 835)
o Lab values data (Quest)
o EMR data
o Market Access data (lives covered, formulary data, organizational structure)

Prior experience in any of the following:

o Life Sciences consulting or IT application development
o Similar experience in other industries such as financial services and healthcare.
o Pharmaceutical Report creation and generation is a plus

Ability to quickly visualize KPIs in a dashboards.

o Heatmaps
o Networks and affiliations
o Geospatial view
o Trend Analysis
o Automated Alerts

Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Ability to work independently

Qualifications:

Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Information Services, Public Health, Business Management
Strong UI design skills for dashboard development
5+ years data visualization software development/delivery experience
3+ years working in the pharma/life sciences industry
2+ years in leading agile teams for analytics deployment


Interested in hearing more? Easy Apply now by clicking the "Apply Now" button.

Principal Engineer III
detail:
JOB SUMMARY
Responsible for engineering activities that maintain and enhance the company's telecommunications and signal processing hardware, software and electrical systems. Works closely with technical operations staff on system design and configuration. Recognized as the technical and design expert. Leads design teams and advises team leaders.

MAJOR DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
Actively and consistently support all efforts to simplify and enhance the customer experience.
Assigned the most complex and critical projects that involve several technical systems and constituents.
Designs, implements, monitors, enhances and troubleshoots systems in assigned areas.
Analyzes and revises existing system logic difficulties and documentation as necessary.
Tests and reviews system designs.
Provides a high level of Engineering Technical support and guidance to regional personnel and ensure all technical integration, changes, standards and documentation are met.
Mentors and guides the work of senior technical staff.
Reviews work plans and designs and advises on improvements.
Adheres to industry specific local, state, and federal regulations, as applicable.
Knows, understands and follows company policy.
Performs other duties as requested by manager.

REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS
Required Skills/Abilities and Knowledge
Ability to read, write and speak the English language to communicate with employees, customers, suppliers, in person, on the phone, and by written communications in a clear, straight-forward, and professional manner
Master expert knowledge of related industry specifications and standards IEEE, ANSI, Fiber (Multimode, Single mode, UTP, etc.), Bridging, Switching, Routing, Ethernet and Transport technologies and protocols
Master expert knowledge in network design, network architecture, protocols and network topology
Master expert knowledge in TCP/IP and the OSI Model
Basic knowledge in using ticketing and software tools to support the current operations.
Master expert knowledge of network devices and basic network appliances
Master expert knowledge of network designing software, such as Visio
Ability to perform duties in a very fast pace environment and ability to learn new technology quickly
Ability to use personal computer and software applications

Required Education
Masters or Bachelor's Degree in Engineering or related field or related work experience

Required Related Work Experience
16+ years Engineering work experience
16+ years Project management work experience

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
Preferred Skills/Abilities and Knowledge
Knowledge of company products and services

Preferred Education
Cisco Certified Internetwork Expert (CCIE)
Industry and vendor specific certifications and training preferred (Cisco, Juniper, Alcatel-Lucent, etc.)

Preferred Related Work Experience and Number of Years

WORKING CONDITIONS
Office environment

title: Principal Engineer III
Junior Full Stack Engineer
subTitle:
Entera
New York, NY 10013
Remote
description:
About Entera:

We are a venture backed real estate technology company with the leading SaaS + Services platform for residential investors. Powered by machine-learning and 100% online, Entera's end-to-end residential real estate platform modernizes the real estate buying process to help our clients access and evaluate more properties, scale their operations, make data-driven investment decisions, and win more often.

Many of the largest real estate investors in the world use Entera's marketplace daily. Entera's annual transaction run rate is over $3.6B across 24 markets since its launch in 2018. Entera has raised $40M of venture capital from some of the most established & trusted firms in the world. The company is headquartered in New York City, New York and Houston, Texas.

About the Role:

As a Junior Full Stack Engineer at Entera, you'll contribute to our React frontend applications that service our core discovery platform and our Ruby on Rails backend API. You'll work tightly with our Senior Engineers and the rest of our engineering organization to make sure that our systems convert and that our customers have a great experience using our platform. You'll be joining a team of highly skilled and motivated Backend, Frontend, and ML engineers helping to deliver on the Entera product roadmap. This is a fast-paced role in a rapidly growing engineering organization and an opportunity to make tangible contributions to the business as it grows.

Successful candidates will thrive in Entera's unique operating environment and culture: high-growth, innovative, lean, and values-driven. As such, successful candidates must be highly capable in each of the following dimensions (among others): adaptability, curiosity, resourcefulness, analytical thinking/problem solving, proactivity, collaboration, technological savvy, and operating with/through a lean team.

What you'll do:

Help develop features in our customer-facing systems
Pair with engineers to integrate backend features and models
Improve our frontend toolkit by keeping our architecture modern and lean
Test your code
Learn to deliver high-quality, maintainable, and scalable code
Participate in code reviews
Work in team sprints

Who You Are:

Basic understanding of Javascript
Basic understanding of how to use React
Basic understanding of Ruby on Rails
Basic understanding of Git within a team environment
Working knowledge of API's in customer facing applications


Entera is proud to be an equal opportunity employer (EEO) that celebrates difference and diversity. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We are committed to building an inclusive work environment where all employees feel a sense of belonging and respect. If there is anything we can do to ensure you have a comfortable and positive interview experience, please let us know.

title: Junior Full Stack Engineer
Full Stack Engineer with FED/CHIPS Payments Experience
subTitle:
Insyto Technology Services US Inc
Remote
Remote
description:
The Full Stack Engineering job is responsible for working across the Technology delivery lifecycle including inception, construction, testing, release and ongoing management of a product or service in a pod within a Technology team.
They will be required to continually enhance their skills within a number of specialisms which include front end, development, security, testing and operational support.

This role will carry out some or all of the following activities:

Provide support across the end-to-end delivery and run lifecycle, utilising their skills and expertise to carry out software development, testing and operational support activities with the ability to move between these according to demand
End-to-end accountability for a product or service, identifying and developing the most appropriate Technology solutions to meet customer needs as part of the Customer Journey
Liaise with other engineers, architects and business stakeholders, to understand and drive the product or service's direction
Establish a digital environment and automate processes to minimize variation and ensure predictable high quality code and data
Create technical test plans and records, including unit and integration tests, within automated test environments to ensure code quality
Provide support to DevOps teams working at all stages of a product or service release/change with a strong customer focus and end-to-end journeys, ensuring they have an excellent domain knowledge
Working with Ops, Dev and Test Engineers to ensure operational issues (performance, operator intervention, alerting, design defect related issues, etc.) are identified and addressed at all stages of a product or service release/change
Provide support in identification and resolution of all incidents associated with the IT service, as directed by leadership of the DevOps team
Ensure service resilience, service sustainability and recovery time objectives are met for all the software solutions delivered
Responsible for automating the continuous integration/continuous delivery pipeline within a DevOps Product/Service team driving a culture of continuous improvement
Keep up-to-date and have expertise on current tools, technologies and areas like cyber security and regulations pertaining to aspects like data privacy, consent, data residency etc. that are applicable
Minimum 5 years experience on Distributed Systems (Red Hat Linux, Oracle Database, Webshpere, MQ, Connect Direct Java)
Minimum 5 years experience as Senior Subject Matter Application Expert
High Value Payments Experience required (Payments Interface on Fed and CHIPS)
Production support required will be required

Job Type: Contract

Pay: $60.00 - $75.00 per hour

Schedule:

8 hour shift

Experience:

FED and CHIPS Payment: 4 years (Preferred)
IBM Direct Connect: 4 years (Preferred)
IBM WebSphere: 5 years (Preferred)
Java: 5 years (Preferred)

Work Location: Remote

Demonstrable experience working with large enterprise data assets
Experience with X12 healthcare transactions such as Eligibility and Claims
Experience with HIPAA compliance and the security of PHI data
Experience with Blockchain based technologies.

title: Principal Software Engineer - Python/AWS
Full Stack Engineer
subTitle:

Remote
Remote
description:
Senior Full-Stack Engineer

SimpleNexus is one of the Inc. 500 Fastest Growing Companies in the United States and was awarded 2020 Best Companies to Work for in Utah. Headquartered in the heart of Silicon Slopes in Lehi, Utah, SimpleNexus is an Enterprise Digital Mortgage Platform; we are the leaders in providing mobile apps for mortgage companies and banks across the nation.

SimpleNexus has been around since 2011 and already we’re serving over 25,000 loan officers. Our culture is built on growth and career development and not only do we have a lot of fun, we always ensure that everyone maintains a healthy work-life balance. We’re growing fast, and we’re excited to add more talent to our team.

Our goal is to unite loan officers, borrowers, and Realtor partners into a single platform to deliver a complete digital mortgage solution.

WHAT WE’RE LOOKING FOR:

At SimpleNexus, we work hard to create a culture of respect for both our employees and customers. Every employee has a direct impact on our product and success, so we value collaboration and input from every team.

We’re looking for engineers who are passionate about creating innovative solutions to our customers’ problems. The ideal candidate would embrace the challenge of addressing time sensitive market demands and delivering customer value, while also focusing on long term technical concerns.

WHAT YOU’LL BE DOING:

As a full-stack engineer at SimpleNexus, you will be collaborating with other engineers, product managers, and UI/UX designers to innovate in and improve on our product. You’ll have opportunities to own the technical planning, implementation, and delivery of impactful features.

Our tech stack includes:
Ruby on Rails
Vue.js
GraphQL
Mobile: Swift, Kotlin

REQUIRED SKILLS:
Is self-motivated and can work with minimal direction. We’re a small team that executes quickly to deliver features to our customers.
3+ years of professional experience working on a software development team
Experience completing and shipping finished products and features
Versed in sound quality assurance principles
Enjoys working across a wide variety of technologies. We use a variety of AWS services and technologies with Rails being the core.
Thrives working on many different projects and systems at one time.
Experience with functional programming languages/paradigms (bonus points for Ruby on Rails experience)
Education Requirement: CS Degree, Lambda School graduation certificate, or equivalent experience

BENEFITS
We work hard and play hard. As our company grows, so does our workplace experience. We want to create an environment where you can get your best work done.

At SimpleNexus, we offer competitive salaries with ample career opportunities. We want our employees to see us as more than just a pit stop on their career roadmap. We believe that as we grow as a company, our employees can grow with us.

For our Full Time employees, SimpleNexus covers 90% of healthcare premiums and has annual HSA contributions. We offer unlimited PTO and encourage a culture of work-life balance.

title: Full Stack Engineer
Principal Backend Engineer (Go, Python, AWS) (100% Remote)
subTitle:
Nira
Remote
Remote
description:
Nira is looking for an experienced backend architect/senior developer to join our fast-growing engineering team working in the cloud content security domain. You will provide technical expertise across design, implementation and support of Python and Golang components in our high performance data processing, storage and integrations areas.




If you’re a creative problem-solver and enjoy a fast-paced work environment, then this is a great opportunity for you.

For operational/team coordination and balance reasons we have a strong preference for this role to be based in the Americas, ie GMT-3 to GMT-7.

What You’ll Do

Lead the design and development of scalable and high performing / high resilience backend services written in Python and Golang.

Solution design/architecture in the general area of event, stream and graph data processing and enterprise SaaS API integration.

Influence design and implementation of integrations which connect Python and Golang components to other parts of Nira’s platform and to 3rd party ecosystems.

Performance engineering to achieve throughput, resilience and enable scaling.

Code standards, code reviews, technical planning/research, testing/QA.

Assist in scoping, estimating, and planning of projects, particularly from a technical architecture perspective.

Assist in leading a squad of 2-5 engineers collaborating to deliver new feature/function bundles.

Mentor and coach other engineers to grow their skills and experience in Python, Golang and complementary AWS technologies.


What We're Looking For

Bachelors degree or equivalent experience, but quite likely a qualification in a quantitative science (computer science, mathematics, engineering, physics, statistics, economics etc).

You’ve got 5-8 years of experience in designing, building and maintaining enterprise services specifically written in Golang or Python, and the broader Golang or Python ecosystems (eg package and dependency management). If you’ve made Open Source contributions in these languages, that’s a bonus.

You’ve got 5+ years of experience with microservices, large scale distributed data processing, message passing and event streaming, and enterprise APIs.

You have high accountability and ownership of your work, but a willingness to collaborate with others to achieve shared goals.

You have a bias towards action. You love to move fast, are self motivated, and a life-long learner.

You care about working on fast-growing products while iterating and sweating the details.

You’re willing to do whatever it takes, even if this means working outside of your role (backend help frontend, frontend help backend, handle customer support, etc).

You’re able to effectively balance speed/quality/tech debt and make engineering decisions that enable speed and quality results.

You’re a product thinker who cares about the customer.

Benefits and Perks

Work From Anywhere - 100% remote/distributed

Flexible Work Schedule

BYO Kit or Company Allowance

Competitive Salary

Unlimited PTO

Medical and Dental (US only)

Reference #3org3
